Title: Data Science Internship
Description:
Welcome to SkillLab

At SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has a pathway to employment. We enable and lead a radical change - a transition towards skill-based labor and education markets. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient markets by connecting people with jobs and education through the universal language of skills. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 35+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.

SkillLab's innovative use of AI was recognised with awards like Google AI for Impact, UNESCO Top 10 uses of AI and the European Social Innovation Competition 2021, among other awards.

Your team

You will directly work with Rihab who is one of SkillLab's Senior Data Scientists. Aaron is SkillLab's Data science Lead. Furthermore, you will cooperate with the other data science team members, Anna, Nadine, and Divabelle.

We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!

Your Responsibilities


Manual data classification & curation: Classify and curate occupation and skill data, ensuring quality and preparing it for AI models
AI/ML pipeline development: Build processes for bulk data, adding quality scores and validation checks for automated classifications
Standards research & implementation: Research international taxonomy standards and best practices, analyze gaps between SkillLab taxonomies and industry standards, recommend improvements and standardization approaches, and assist in mapping between different classification systems
Taxonomy enrichment & mapping: Enrich existing taxonomies with additional metadata, create cross-references between occupation and skill categories, develop hierarchical relationships and skill clusters, and map emerging occupations and skills to existing frameworks


Your Skills


Study background in Data Science, Computational Linguistics, Information Science, or a related field
Familiarity with Python, SQL, data analysis, and visualization (using tools like pandas, matplotlib, seaborn)
Adept at statistical analysis, data exploration, pattern recognition, data cleaning, transformation, and quality assessment
Familiarity with taxonomies, ontologies, or classification systems and experience with data analysis, reporting, and visualization
Understanding of occupation classification systems (like ESCO, O*NET, ISCO), skills frameworks, competency models, labor market data, and employment terminology


Extra awesome


Hands-on experience with taxonomy management tools
Familiarity with machine learning classification processes and models
Experience in mapping and integrating diverse classification systems


Requirements


You are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don't support visa applications for applicants outside the EU
You are currently enrolled as a student or graduated within the last 12 months
You are able to commit to a six-month full-time (40 hour/week) internship


Compensation, start-date & location


This is a paid internship. The monthly reimbursement will be 1.000 EUR
You can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to Amsterdam
We accept applications on a rolling basis and we envision a start date in September 2025


Benefits


You will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional development
You will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)
You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Alleo app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online stores
You will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats


Our selection procedure


You apply for the role and we review your profile
We will invite you for a short screening call
We will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve you preparing a short assignment
We will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the role


What else to know?


This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and priorities
If this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting!
Get 4 tips for your job application at SkillLab

Title: AI Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

AgileTribe Consulting is a leading expert in AI native transformation, agile transformations, helping businesses adapt and thrive in a dynamic market. Our experienced coaches and consultants offer tailored roadmaps, agile training, agile project management, and coaching to foster continuous improvement. We focus on delivering customized strategies, emphasizing culture, leadership, and collaboration for proven results. AgileTribe Consulting is committed to providing long-term support and driving agile excellence.




Job Mission

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models and algorithms that support various business functions. You’ll collaborate with data scientists, engineers, software developers, and stakeholders to deliver ML-powered products and services that create measurable value. You’ll also contribute to the development and management of AI services within our data analytics platform.




Roles and Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models to solve complex business challenges.
Ensure ML models are scalable, traceable, and maintainable in production environments, using cloud or on-premise infrastructure.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver impactful ML solutions.
Perform data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training, evaluation, and monitoring.
Stay current with emerging ML technologies and integrate them where appropriate.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and documentation to ensure high-quality deliverables.
Monitor and maintain deployed models to ensure performance, reliability, and accuracy.
Develop best practices and standards for ML development, including CI/CD templates and MLOps frameworks.
Implement containerization strategies using tools like Docker and Kubernetes.




Education and Experience

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in machine learning, data science, or related domains.
Hands-on experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with software engineering practices.
Experience with cloud platforms (Azure required; GCP preferred).
Knowledge of MLOps, model lifecycle management, and CI/CD pipelines.
Experience deploying and maintaining ML models in production.
Familiarity with data privacy and security standards (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27000) is a plus.
Ability to mentor junior team members and contribute to the growth of AI capabilities.




Skills and Competencies

Strong passion for machine learning and solving real-world problems.
Customer-centric and value-driven approach to solution development.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset.
Effective communication and collaboration skills across diverse teams.
Deep understanding of ML algorithms, techniques, and best practices.
Knowledge of data architecture and modeling concepts.
Familiarity with agile methodologies and DevOps practices.
Ability to drive automation for scalability and efficiency.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Fintech - Amsterdam - €55,000




Want to build ML systems that power millions of transactions worldwide?




A leading global fintech company is looking for an ML Engineer to join their ML Platform team. You’ll help develop scalable, production-ready systems that enable real-time fraud detection and payment optimisation—delivering real impact to customers and merchants across the globe.




This is an opportunity to grow alongside talented engineers, take ownership of end-to-end features, and contribute to a platform that handles billions in transactions every year.




What you’ll be working on…

Designing, building, and maintaining systems for training, deploying, and monitoring ML models at scale.
Expanding and optimising the company’s feature store for complex online and offline use cases.
Owning end-to-end delivery of ML features, from concept to production.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure models are robust, efficient, and impactful.




What we’re looking for…

1+ year commercial ML experience
Solid Python development skills, with a focus on clean, production-ready code.
Experience working with production ML models and MLOps best practices.
Familiarity with cloud-based development (AWS preferred).
Knowledge of one or more ML tools/frameworks such as scikit-learn, XGBoost, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, or SageMaker.
Curiosity, adaptability, and a willingness to tackle open-ended challenges.




Why join?

You’ll have the freedom to deliver meaningful work, the support of a high-performing team, and the chance to make a huge impacts on global commerce.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Junior data scientist - AI for healthcare

Are you a Data Scientist who wants to apply your expertise in AI to improve the quality of life of vulnerable people? Then join us at Mentech to work on our groundbreaking products Hume and Noa!




About Mentech

Mentech is a high-tech company based in Eindhoven, driven by the mission to improve the quality of life of vulnerable individuals. Every day, our dedicated team of hardware designers, data scientists, software developers, behavioral experts, and consultants works on groundbreaking innovations at the intersection of technology and care.




People with intellectual disabilities or dementia often struggle to express emotions, pain, or discomfort. This can lead to stress, behavioral challenges, and difficulties for caregivers in providing the right support.




At Mentech, we develop innovative AI-driven solutions to make emotions and stress visible, prevent loneliness, and improve the quality of care.

Hume is our emotion recognition platform, using wearable sensors, behavioral models, and machine learning to detect stress from physiological signals (heart rate, skin conductance, movement). It helps caregivers better understand clients and provide meaningful care.
Noa is our AI assistant for long-term care, designed to support caregivers and clients with intelligent interventions, such as reducing overstimulation or preventing loneliness through personalized interaction.

Together, Hume and Noa shape the future of compassionate and data-driven healthcare.




Job description

As a Data Scientist at Mentech, you will join a multidisciplinary team of data scientists, software engineers, and healthcare experts. You will design, develop, and validate AI and algorithms that directly impact mental well-being and quality of life. You will work on diverse projects ranging from physiological signal processing to behavioral modeling and AI-driven interventions.




Main responsibilities

Develop and optimize neural networks and machine learning models for stress recognition, emotion detection, and behavioral prediction.
Work with multimodal data sources (wearables, sensors, contextual data, interaction logs).
Contribute to the development of Noa’s AI-driven intervention engine and Hume’s stress detection models.
Perform data preprocessing, feature extraction, and model validation with a strong focus on reliability and clinical relevance.
Collaborate with electrical engineers, software developers, and healthcare professionals to translate real-world needs into technical solutions.
Data collection




Your profile

MSc in Data Science, AI, Cognitive Neuroscience, Biomedical Engineering, or related field.
1+ years of experience in developing and deploying AI models, preferably in healthcare or life sciences.
Programming skills in Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow/PyTorch, SciPy).
Familiarity with guardrails and LLM personalization.
Familiarity with version control (Git) and cloud environments (AWS preferred).
Familiarity with Agile development is a plus.
Team player with excellent communication skills.
Passion for improving the lives of vulnerable people.




What we offer

Competitive salary aligned with your experience.
Flexible work arrangements, including hybrid options.
30 days of paid leave per year, based on fulltime employment
Time, budget and guidance for professional development
A multidisciplinary and international team of +-25 professionals.
Direct collaboration with care institutions and universities.
Opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth.
A chance to make real-world impact by developing AI that improves quality of life.




Interested?

Would you like to contribute to meaningful innovation in healthcare? Do you want to help shape the future of AI in care with Hume and Noa?

Apply now for the position of Senior Data Scientist at Mentech!




This position is primarily on-site at our Eindhoven office, with some hybrid flexibility. We therefore welcome applicants who are already based in or around Eindhoven. We are not working with external recruitment agencies for this vacancy.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
For one of our clients in the financial services industry, we are seeking an Experienced Data Scientist to strengthen their growing AI & Data team. This position offers the chance to work on complex challenges where advanced analytics and machine learning directly improve business processes and customer experience.




The Role

As a Data Scientist, you will take ownership of transforming business needs into concrete AI solutions. You will be developing, deploying, and maintaining models in production while ensuring they deliver measurable value.




Key responsibilities include:

Designing and implementing AI-driven solutions using machine learning, LLMs, and cloud-based services.
Partnering with stakeholders to identify opportunities for process optimization through data science.
Guiding junior colleagues and contributing to knowledge sharing across the data community.
Continuously improving models already in production, ensuring their accuracy and relevance over time.




What’s in it for you

Salary: up to €6500 gross per month, based on 40 hours/week and experience.
Extras: 13th month and holiday allowance included in monthly pay.
Leave: 27 vacation days
Pension: Modern and competitive scheme.
Flexibility: Hybrid setup (office in Rotterdam) with support for home office costs.
Development: Extensive opportunities for training, upskilling, and career progression.
Mobility: Public transport card or travel reimbursement.




Your Profile

Proficiency in Dutch is required.
MSc in Data Science, Econometrics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience applying machine learning in production.
Advanced Python skills, with strong knowledge of data preparation, model evaluation, and deployment.
Familiarity with CI/CD, Git, SQL, and ideally Azure environments.
Strong communication and consulting skills, able to collaborate with diverse stakeholders.




The Environment

You will join a specialized AI & Data team operating within the pensions domain of a leading financial services provider. The team works closely with business experts and other data professionals, including visualization, data management, and advanced analytics colleagues. You’ll also be part of a wider data science guild of around 50 peers, offering opportunities for collaboration, learning, and career acceleration.




Interested in shaping the future of AI in financial services?

Apply now and bring your expertise to an environment where innovation and impact go hand in hand.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Platform Engineer | Machine Learning & MLOps | Amsterdam

My client, a specialist Software Engineering business, is investing in an MLOps Engineer to help design, build, and scale cloud-ready ML platforms, powering reliable and production-ready machine learning for major brands.




Responsibilities:

Build and enhance end-to-end MLOps workflows — from model training and deployment to monitoring and lifecycle management.
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to design CI/CD pipelines and automate workflows.
Develop data pipelines and ETL processes to support predictive and real-time applications.
Share best practices in software engineering, observability, and cloud-native development.




Experience:

Strong Python skills and experience with ML frameworks (e.g., scikit-learn, MLFlow, TensorFlow).
Workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow).
Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD automation expertise.
GCP or Azure experience.
Bonus: Distributed systems, Spark, Kafka, or large-scale ETL.
Native-level Dutch language




Why:

Shape the future of AI & data-driven platforms.
Work on high-impact projects with major brands.
Collaborate with a senior team of engineers & ML experts.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.

Responsibilities:


Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
Develop tools for collecting and processing data
Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems
Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain



Required knowledge of:


Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
Computer Science or Math degree
English Intermediate+



Would be a plus:


Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision
Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)



What we offer:


Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
English classes on our corporate platform
Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions



Note: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.
Show more
HTML:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
  • Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
  • Develop tools for collecting and processing data
  • Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems
  • Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
  • Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
  • Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain


Required knowledge of:

  • Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
  • Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
  • Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
  • Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
  • Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
  • Computer Science or Math degree
  • English Intermediate+


Would be a plus:

  • Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
  • Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
  • Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision
  • Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)


What we offer:

  • Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
  • Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
  • We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
  • Company computer equipment by request
  • Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
  • English classes on our corporate platform
  • Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
  • Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions


Note: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At RebelsAI, we turn the potential of Generative AI into real-world impact. We help companies become truly AI-driven by building smart, scalable solutions that actually work. From the first idea to implementation, we make AI practical and valuable.




As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work closely with our founding team. You will design and build the systems that power our AI products and prototypes. You will have real influence and the freedom to explore and grow as part of a young and ambitious startup.




What you will do

You will work hands-on with data, models and cloud tools to build the technical core of our AI solutions. Your work helps clients automate, improve and innovate.




You will:

Build and deploy machine learning models using platforms like Google Cloud, Azure and AWS
Design ML pipelines with tools such as Vertex AI, BigQuery, Dataflow and Dataproc
Choose the right infrastructure for each job, whether that is VMs, containers, GPUs or TPUs
Apply strong data security and privacy practices in every project
Work closely with consultants and clients to solve real problems with real value
Experiment with GenAI tools and turn ideas into working prototypes
Help shape solutions from first version to production-ready




What you bring

You have a strong technical foundation and a curious mindset. You are eager to build real things and see them used in the world.
A degree in AI, Data Science, Computer Science or a related field
Solid Python skills and experience with libraries like NumPy, Pandas and scikit-learn
A good understanding of machine learning principles and data analysis
Familiarity with cloud environments such as Azure, GCP or AWS
Fluent in Dutch and English




Experience with tools like LangChain, vector databases or GenAI architectures is a plus but not required. You will have the space to learn and grow.




The kind of Rebel we are looking for

We are looking for someone who is hands-on, self-starting and not afraid to ask questions. You enjoy variety, take initiative and want to be part of a team that builds and learns together.




You are:

Eager to learn and try new things
Confident working independently and with others
Practical and focused on delivering results
Passionate about the possibilities of AI and how it can help people and organizations

What we offer

A growing startup where your voice matters
A small and driven team that supports and challenges each other
Competitive salary
Laptop and travel expense reimbursement
Flexibility to work 4 or 5 days a week
Hybrid working setup with a base in Rotterdam




About RebelsAI

We help organizations get the most out of Generative AI. From workshops and readiness scans to tailored applications and long-term strategy, we guide our clients every step of the way. We focus on what is useful, realistic and impactful. AI should help people thrive.

Ready to build what is next




If this sounds like the right challenge for you, we would love to meet. Send us your resume and a short note about why you are excited to join RebelsAI. Visit us at rebelsai.nl or find us on LinkedIn. We welcome all backgrounds and perspectives. We believe diverse teams build better solutions.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Want to shape the future of global logistics with AI?




We're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer specialised in Reinforcement Learning, to help us scale our AI planning suite that's already running at some of the world's biggest container terminals.

We are currently looking for candidates who already live in the Netherlands.




Who are we?

At loadmaster.ai, we specialise in deploying Reinforcement Learning (RL) to automate and optimise complex planning and scheduling processes for logistics operations at container terminals. Our solution applies RL driven optimisation to significantly enhance efficiency, reliability, and speed at container terminals.

Our core mission is clear, yet challenging: use advanced RL and software engineering to streamline and automate decision-making, helping terminals operate at peak efficiency while drastically reducing complexity.




Your challenges?




We have a solid technological foundation built in the previous few years with a team of multiple ML engineers. You will be an integral part of our ML engineer team, and be given broad independence to execute the project. 

This means we count on your active participation, out of the box thinking, project management skills, innovative ideas, initiative and good communication skills when it comes to, but not limited to, the design and implementation of our to be developed product. You’ll be working together with the other dedicated ML engineer on this project and where needed developers and ML engineers from our sister companies.




What do we require? 

At least a masters or a PhD in mathematics, computer science, data science, artificial intelligence or other relevant studies.




Experience with:

Reinforcement learning, Linear programming, evolutionary algorithms, and similar




Good Coding methodologies including

Implementing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
Git
Dev(Sec)Ops practices
Deep understanding of development principles, and the ability to write clean, reliable and maintainable code. Design patterns, programming principles and best practices is a must

﻿

Interest in the real world effects of your code
Excellent communication skills
Basic project management skills
Independent 
Ambitious




Preferred

A Github account so code style can be judged better.
History of collaboration with experts and the ability to communicate technical concepts to a non technical audience.




What do we offer?

An innovative, flat-hierarchy environment where your contributions make a direct impact on the company’s success and growth. An exciting opportunity to build and enhance cutting-edge solutions using RL. Significant autonomy in project execution, empowering you to innovate, experiment, and see immediate results from your work. A collaborative and motivated team passionate about bringing AI-driven improvements to the logistics industry. Ongoing opportunities to learn and grow professionally, working at the intersection of logistics and AI




We are at the forefront of applying reinforcement learning to revolutionise logistics. If you're excited about joining a pioneering team at loadmaster.ai and tackling meaningful challenges at scale, we'd love to hear from you!




We believe in a quick and efficient hiring process. We believe that your time is valuable, as are ours. As such, we anticipate no more than 2 rounds of interviews on average.




Apply now to become part of our ambitious journey.




P.S. - please elaborate your RL experience clearly in your resume

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer Artificial Intelligence
Description:
AI / Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Eindhoven
Salary: € 5.500 - € 6.500
Living in NL already
No ZZP allowed




Introduction

Are you passionate about applying machine learning to drive innovation and create tangible value? Do you see how advanced ML can transform the semiconductor industry? Would you like to join a team building cutting-edge ML solutions for a global data analytics platform? If so, we want to hear from you.




Job Mission

As a Machine Learning Engineer in the Data Analytics organization, you will design, develop, and deploy ML models and algorithms that support teams across the company. You will collaborate with data scientists, engineers, developers, and business stakeholders to deliver ML-driven products and services. You will also help shape and maintain the AI services within the enterprise data analytics platform in the IT Chief Data Office.




Roles and Responsibilities

Design, build, and deploy scalable, maintainable, and traceable machine learning models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into ML-driven solutions.
Handle data preprocessing, feature engineering, model development, evaluation, and monitoring.
Integrate ML models into production environments (cloud and/or on-premise).
Stay current with the latest ML technologies and apply them as appropriate.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and documentation to ensure quality.
Monitor and maintain deployed ML models to meet performance, reliability, and accuracy targets.
Contribute to best practices and standards for machine learning across the organization, including CI/CD templates, MLOps frameworks, and process guidelines.
Develop and apply containerization strategies for ML applications (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).




Education and Experience

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or related field.
5+ years of relevant experience in machine learning, data science, or similar roles.
Strong experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.).
Proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure; knowledge of GCP is a plus.
Solid understanding of MLOps practices, data preparation, feature engineering, model evaluation, and CI/CD.
Proven track record deploying and maintaining ML models in production.
Awareness of standards and regulations such as GDPR, ISO 27000 is a plus.
Experience mentoring junior team members and improving AI service capabilities.




Skills

Strong passion for machine learning and solving real-world challenges.
Customer- and value-driven mindset in developing ML solutions.
In-depth knowledge of ML algorithms, techniques, and best practices.
Understanding of data architecture and data modeling.
Familiarity with agile and scrum practices.
Strong background in software engineering and automation, with Python as the preferred language.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My client within the Finance sector in The Hague are on the look out for a Data Scientist to join their team.




The role is ideal for a junior Data Scientist looking to improve their skills by being guided by the best in class.




The ideal candidate is enthusiastic and had a growth mindset to improve.




Requirements:

• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a relevant field (AI, Computer Science, Maths, Physics etc.)

• Knowledge of forecasting is ideal but not required

• 0-3 years of industry experience

• Python and SQL knowledge.




Salary Package:

• Up to €70,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Annual bonus.

• Pension Plan




You can apply right here, or alternatively you can reach me on the following:

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

As a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with clients and interdisciplinary teams to develop impactful analytics solutions, optimize code, and solve real-world business problems across diverse industries. You’ll grow as a technologist by contributing to cutting-edge projects, R&D, and global conferences while working alongside world-class talent in a dynamic, innovative environment.

In this role, you will partner with clients to understand their needs and develop impactful analytics solutions. You will translate business problems into analytical challenges, build models to solve them, and ensure they are evaluated with relevant metrics. You’ll also contribute to internal tools, participate in R&D projects, and have opportunities to attend and present at conferences like NIPS and ICML.

Your work will create real-world impact. By identifying patterns in data and delivering innovative solutions, you will help clients maintain their competitive advantage and transform their day-to-day operations. Your contributions will directly influence business outcomes and drive lasting improvements across industries.

You will be in Amsterdam or Brussels, and collaborate closely with data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers, and product managers around the world working on interdisciplinary projects that use math, statistics, and machine learning to derive insights from raw data. You will help global companies transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries such as healthcare, automotive, energy, and elite sports.

At McKinsey, you’ll thrive in an unparalleled environment for growth. You’ll develop a sought-after perspective by connecting technology and business value, tackle real-life challenges across diverse industries, and collaborate with inspiring multidisciplinary teams, gaining a holistic understanding of AI and its potential to drive transformation.

Our Tech Stack

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelors, Masters or PhD level in a discipline such as: computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence.
0-2+ years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
Programming experience (focus on machine learning): R and/or Python (must), SPSS, SAS, Ruby, Hadoop (valued).
Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines.
Demonstrated aptitude for analytics.
While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English, with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels. Knowledge of French or Dutch is valued.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields.
Willingness to travel.
Show more

  • Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines.
  • Demonstrated aptitude for analytics.
  • While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English, with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels. Knowledge of French or Dutch is valued.
  • Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
  • Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields.
  • Willingness to travel.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Over de vacature


Ben jij een Data Scientist die energie haalt uit het bouwen van schaalbare modellen met echte impact op de operatie? En wil je bijdragen aan de data-gedreven groei van een organisatie met honderden locaties in binnen- en buitenland? Lees dan verder!


Over de functie


Voor een pragmatische en mensgerichte organisatie zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist die data-oplossingen weet te vertalen naar zichtbare impact op de werkvloer. Deze organisatie is actief in hospitality met meer dan 600 locaties in binnen- en buitenland. Ze zetten stevig in op data-gedreven werken en zoeken versterking om deze transformatie verder uit te bouwen.


Je werkt in een team van 8 specialisten (data engineers, analisten en data scientists). De verdeling van je werkzaamheden zijn 15% operations, 20% overleg en 60% nieuwe features. Je beweegt je tussen data science, ML engineering en de business.


Wat ga je doen?


Je bent verantwoordelijk voor:


  • Je ontwikkelt en beheert voorspellende modellen die schaalbaar zijn en direct bijdragen aan de dagelijkse operatie – denk aan het inschatten van bezoekersaantallen per locatie.
  • Je richt geautomatiseerde machine learning-processen in en versterkt de onderliggende infrastructuur voor data science.
  • Je haalt waarde uit data en vertaalt deze naar slimme procesoptimalisaties en kostenbesparingen.
  • Je speelt een actieve rol in het uitbreiden van data-gedreven werken binnen onze vestigingen in onder meer Frankrijk en Duitsland.
  • Je werkt intensief samen met collega’s uit verschillende lagen van de organisatie – van operatie tot management.
  • Je bewaakt de datakwaliteit en weet inzichten helder, overtuigend en gericht over te brengen aan relevante stakeholders.


Wie ben jij?


Je bent een generalist die het leuk vindt om met meerdere facetten bezig te zijn: Data Science, Machine Learning en de Business. Verder heb je:


  • Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist;
  • Ervaring met Python;
  • Minimaal een HBO opleiding;
  • Nederlands sprekend;
  • Je vindt het leuk om met collega's samen te werken.


Over de organisatie


Binnen deze organisatie krijg je de vrijheid om zelfstandig te werken aan projecten met directe invloed op de business. Je ontwikkelt voorspellende modellen en vertaalt inzichten naar praktische verbeteringen, samen met collega’s uit de operatie. Met meer dan 600 locaties verspreid over meerdere landen is er volop ruimte om data science-oplossingen van de grond af aan op te bouwen. De resultaten van jouw werk zijn tastbaar: betere personeelsplanning, slimmere inkoop en efficiëntere productie, met merkbare effecten op de dagelijkse prestaties van de locaties.


Wat bieden we je?


  • Salaris tot €5.200;
  • Je krijgt een 13e maand;
  • 32 - 40 uur per week werken;
  • 25 vakantie dagen en optie om bij te kopen;
  • 8% vakantiegeld Uitstekende pensioenregeling;
  • Laptop en telefoon van de zaak;
  • Hybride werken;
  • Kilometer vergoeding.


Interesse?


Ben jij klaar om impact te maken met data in een omgeving die ertoe doet? Neem dan contact met ons op. Stuur je CV mee, dan kijken we samen of jouw profiel past bij deze unieke kans.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🌍 Data Scientist (AI | ESG | Sustainability) – Join the Tribe! 🚀




📍 Location: Amsterdam (Hybrid, 2–3 days in office)

📆 Full-time / Part-time

💰 Salary: €4.500 – €6.500 per month (depending on experience) + mobility budget, internet allowance, 24 vacation days




🌱 Why Join Data Tribes?

At Data Tribes, we believe that data is not just numbers, it’s stories waiting to be told and solutions waiting to make the world greener. We’re a startup with impact, helping organizations transform their data into sustainability-driven decisions that matter.




Here you’re not a job title, you’re potential. We value team spirit, fun and growth. Expect a place where you can debate fiercely, laugh loudly, and learn endlessly, because that’s how the best ideas are born. No corporate politics. Just a passionate team on a mission to change the way companies use data for good.




🔥 Your Role as Data Scientist

As a Data Scientist at Data Tribes, you turn complex questions into concrete, data-driven solutions. You’ll be:

✅ Translating business challenges into algorithms, dashboards, and models that drive real-world impact
✅ Working with structured and unstructured data to deliver insights that matter
✅ Building predictive models, machine learning pipelines, and statistical analyses
✅ Creating data stories and visualizations that bring insights to life (because visuals stick better than dry facts)
✅ Collaborating closely with clients, often leading projects from discovery to delivery
✅ Exploring advanced methods like Graph Neural Networks, Topic Modeling, LLMs, Deep Learning, Clustering, Optimization and Tree-Based Models




💡 What We’re Looking For

Must-haves:

🎯 Experience as a Data Scientist / Data Analyst with a proven track record
🎯 Strong skills in Python, R, or similar for modeling & analysis
🎯 Knowledge of machine learning and statistical methods
🎯 Ability to switch between business and tech worlds with ease

Nice-to-haves:

🌍 Experience with ESG / sustainability data / agri, food and beverages
🤖 Familiarity with LLMs, Deep Learning, or Neural Networks
📊 Experience with visualization & storytelling tools (Power BI, Tableau, Plotly, etc.)
🔍 Knowledge of data engineering basics (SQL, pipelines, cloud platforms)




🎁 What’s In It for You?

🚀 Impact & purpose: work on projects that make a difference in ESG & sustainability

🌍 Hybrid freedom: flexibility to balance office buzz with home focus time

📚 Growth: training budget, certifications, and the chance to explore new AI/ML methods

💰 Rewards: salary €4.500–€6.500 + mobility budget, laptop, internet + mobile phone allowance, 24 vacation days

👕 Culture: work in a place where fun, teamwork, and innovation come first




📈 Your Growth Path

At Data Tribes, we see growth as a shared journey. From Data Scientist you can evolve into:

Senior / Lead Data Scientist
AI/ML Specialist
Data Science Consultant with ESG focus

You’ll define your path. We’ll back you with mentorship, projects and trust.




🎯 Ready to Join the Tribe?

If you want your algorithms, dashboards, and ideas to shape a greener tomorrow, this is your chance.




👉 Apply now and let’s turn data into impact, together.

👉 Apply now and let’s turn data into impact, together.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sopra Steria is een Europese techpartner met meer dan 56.000 collega’s in 30 landen. We helpen organisaties met slimme, schaalbare softwareoplossingen. Technologie is het middel, mensen maken het verschil.




Je werkt in Groningen, vanuit de Data-practice van Sopra Steria Noord. Hier komen data scientists, business consultants en engineers samen om oplossingen te bouwen die klanten vooruithelpen. Dat doen we voor organisaties in de publieke en private sector, op het snijvlak van AI, analytics en strategisch advies.




Naast de dataprofessionals werk je samen met collega’s uit teams als Strategy & Business Design, Product Management, Java, Microsoft, frontend en agile testing. Samen brengen we de brug tot stand tussen techniek en organisatie.




The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.




Vacatureomschrijving

Als Data Scientist bij Sopra Steria werk je aan projecten waar data écht het verschil maakt. Je past AI toe in de praktijk: van fraudedetectie tot betalingsstromen analyseren, van aanbevelingssystemen tot NLP-oplossingen voor de overheid.




Je werkt met Python, R, notebooks en cloudomgevingen als Azure of AWS. Of je nu modellen bouwt, bestaande modellen in productie brengt of met klanten spart over wat er écht nodig is, jij zorgt dat data ook echt werkt.




Een greep uit je werkzaamheden:

bouwen, testen en verbeteren van machine learning-modellen
toepassen van deep learning, NLP, computer vision of anomaliedetectie
in productie brengen van modellen via MLOps-principes
samenwerken met collega’s uit verschillende expertises, zowel technisch als strategisch
klantdata interpreteren, onderbouwen en vertalen naar concrete waarde




Je werkt hybride, met Groningen als vaste standplaats.




Functie-eisen

Je bent nieuwsgierig, analytisch en weet hoe je complexe modellen vertaalt naar iets wat klanten ook echt kunnen gebruiken. Je werkt graag samen met anderen, maar pakt ook zelfstandig je verantwoordelijkheid.




Wat jij meebrengt:

een masterdiploma of vergelijkbare ervaring binnen data science, machine learning of AI
ervaring met Python of R
kennis van supervised en unsupervised learning, deep learning of NLP
ervaring met het in productie brengen van modellen, bijvoorbeeld via Azure, AWS of GCP
affiniteit met explainable AI, MLOps of bijvoorbeeld anomaly detection
je spreekt Nederlands op minimaal B2-niveau







Je krijgt de ruimte om je werk op jouw manier te doen. We vertrouwen op je expertise en zorgen dat je de juiste mensen en middelen om je heen hebt om te groeien.




Wat je kunt verwachten:

direct een vast contract met een goed salaris
een mobiliteitsbudget of leaseauto
laptop, telefoon en thuiswerkbudget
27 vakantiedagen (7 via het Flex Benefits-budget), met de mogelijkheid om bij te kopen tot 40 dagen
een pensioenregeling en collectieve zorgverzekering
toegang tot meer dan 250 trainingen via de Sopra Steria Academy
deelname aan meetups, kennissessies en events binnen en buiten je vakgebied
en leuke uitjes met je team, van game nights tot een dagje Efteling




Je sluit je aan bij de Data-practice binnen Area Noord. Een team waar kennisdelen vanzelf gaat, inhoud voorop staat en waar je samenwerkt met collega’s uit verschillende expertises.




Ben je klaar om met ons de wereld vorm te geven? Mooi. We kijken uit naar je sollicitatie.

  • en leuke uitjes met je team, van game nights tot een dagje Efteling


Je sluit je aan bij de Data-practice binnen Area Noord. Een team waar kennisdelen vanzelf gaat, inhoud voorop staat en waar je samenwerkt met collega’s uit verschillende expertises.


Ben je klaar om met ons de wereld vorm te geven? Mooi. We kijken uit naar je sollicitatie.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

We are brand builders who focus our passion and creativity to build Calvin Klein and TOMMY HILFIGER into the most desirable lifestyle brands in the world and at the same time position PVH as one of the best-performing brand groups in our sector. Guided by our values and enabled by our scale and global reach, we are driving fashion forward for good, as one team with one vision and one plan. That’s the Power of Us, that’s the Power of PVH+.   

One of PVH’s greatest strengths is our people. Our collective desire is to create a workplace environment where every individual is valued, and every voice is heard, and we are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. Learn more about Inclusion & Diversity at PVH here.

Be part of an iconic story. PVH is the growth platform for Calvin Klein and TOMMY HILFIGER. Through driving brand strength and relevance, we are connecting our global, iconic brands closer to where the consumer is going than ever before, today and with future generations. Guided by our values and enabled by our scale and global reach, we are driving fashion forward for good, as one team with one vision and one plan. That’s the Power of Us, that’s the Power of PVH+.

The supply chain of PVH Europe is embarking on an ambitious and challenging journey of transformation to become future-proof: digitalized, automated, and data-driven. The Data Scientist will join the efforts of the Supply Chain Data Science and Analytics team in helping make this transformation a reality.

The focus will be on supply chain operational processes with the key responsibility of fast-forwarding the current supply chain structure leveraging big data & analytics. The Data Scientist will join a team developing algorithms to solve specific optimization problems (e.g., containers fill-rate optimization and prioritization, stock slotting optimization) and building predictive models (e.g., vessels arrival time prediction, customers estimated delivery date prediction). The Data Scientist will also support the team in maintaining and developing automated routines to granularly digitalize the operational day-by-day of the supply chain central operations teams.

The PositionThe Data Scientist will tackle a variety of problems, some of them for the first time ever in the organization, extract data-driven business insights, and develop automated solutions and machine-learning models bringing supply chain to the next level. To achieve these objectives, the Data Scientist will work in a team that is fully integrated and in continuous collaboration with its business stakeholders: Inbound Logistics, Distribution Center, Order-Fulfilment, Operations and Planning teams. The Data Scientist needs, therefore, not only to be able to translate complex mathematical concepts into clearly understandable information for a wide audience, but also to be comfortable in an environment that highly value human contact and close team collaboration.

The supply chain of PVH Europe is laying the ground for an exciting road of digital growth and transformation and the Supply Chain Data Science and Analytics team is looking forward to embed a candidate sharing the team passion for data, mathematics, machine learning, and the delivery of business-impactful data-driven solutions.

Key Responsibilities


Build optimization and machine-learning models to predict decisive information for supply chain business operations, and maintain the end-to-end computational structure around them to support daily operations.
Perform analyses of large amount of data related to supply chain processes to extract business insight.
Develop mathematical models describing the empirical supply chain processes.
Maintain and develop ETL routines to increasingly digitalize supply chain operations.
Contribute to the problem-solving process and support business stakeholders finding the right analytical solution.
Communicate with business stakeholders in a clear, understandable, and actionable way even the more complex mathematical concepts.


The Ideal Candidate


Master degree in natural sciences (e.g., mathematics, physics), engineering disciplines (e.g., computer engineering) or econometrics.
At least 2-3 years’ experience working as data scientist, or, and a Ph.D. in one of the aforementioned disciplines.
Advanced knowledge of statistics and mathematics.
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Proven experience with programming languages, particularly Python.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and related programing packages (e.g., scikit-learn).
Knowledge of supply chain processes will be given preference.
Knowledge in cloud computing, BI visualization tools (e.g., Power BI), Excel, and Power Point is desirable.
Good project management and planning capacities, and is reliable, and looking for ownership.
A pro-active attitude and is eager to develop in a fast-paced environment and young team.
Excellent communication skills and can translate complex information into clear insights and comfortable presenting in front of senior leadership audiences.


Be valued. In the heart of Amsterdam, PVH EMEA is home to the global headquarters of Tommy Hilfiger and the European offices of Calvin Klein. We are the home to 2500 big thinkers, natural entrepreneurs, and challenge seekers from all kinds of backgrounds.

How we support you: hybrid setup (3 days in office), in addition to meeting-free Fridays, work from anywhere 4 weeks a year, 25 days of paid holidays, mental health days, parental leave, home office allowance, commuting allowances, employee assistance programs, and pension schemes.

Wellbeing: exclusive onsite gym and fitness classes, personal training, meditation studio, sports clubs, in-house physio, and receive access to our nutritional and wellbeing programs.

Campus: extensive food and beverage offerings, top-notch restaurant, barista coffee bars, sky bar, monthly social events, weekly Thursday drinks, game nights, and campus-themed activities that will keep your social life busy.

Develop your career: whether you lead a team or contribute your own expertise, everyone is a leader at PVH. PVH University curates and delivers training programs for you to continuously develop your professional and personal goals

Be at the forefront: stay closely connected to our brands, Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, and be a part of seasonal market launches, sample sales and receive employee discounts!

Be part of it.PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

Your Wellbeing is Our Priority

In the heart of Amsterdam, PVH is home to the global headquarters of Tommy Hilfiger and the European offices of Calvin Klein.


Wellbeing: exclusive onsite gym and fitness classes, personal training, meditation studio, sports clubs, in-house physio, and receive access to our nutritional and wellbeing programs
Campus: extensive food and beverage offerings, top-notch restaurant, barista coffee bars, sky bar, monthly social events, weekly Thursday drinks, game nights, and campus-themed activities that will keep your social life busy
Develop your career: whether you lead a team or contribute your own expertise, everyone is a leader at PVH. PVH University curates and delivers training programs for you to continuously develop your professional and personal goals
Be at the forefront: stay closely connected to our brands, CALVIN KLEIN and TOMMY HILFIGER, and be a part of seasonal market launches, sample sales and receive employee discounts!


Check out our Amsterdam Campus here.

PVH Corp. or its subsidiary ("PVH") is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment on the basis of their individual capabilities and qualifications without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. In addition to complying with all applicable laws, PVH is also committed to ensuring that all current and future PVH associates are compensated solely on job-related factors such as skill, ability, educational background, work quality, experience and potential.

How we support you: hybrid setup (3 days in office), in addition to meeting-free Fridays, work from anywhere 4 weeks a year, 25 days of paid holidays, mental health days, parental leave, home office allowance, commuting allowances, employee assistance programs, and pension schemes.

Wellbeing: exclusive onsite gym and fitness classes, personal training, meditation studio, sports clubs, in-house physio, and receive access to our nutritional and wellbeing programs.

Campus: extensive food and beverage offerings, top-notch restaurant, barista coffee bars, sky bar, monthly social events, weekly Thursday drinks, game nights, and campus-themed activities that will keep your social life busy.

Develop your career: whether you lead a team or contribute your own expertise, everyone is a leader at PVH. PVH University curates and delivers training programs for you to continuously develop your professional and personal goals

Be at the forefront: stay closely connected to our brands, Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, and be a part of seasonal market launches, sample sales and receive employee discounts!

Be part of it.PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

Your Wellbeing is Our Priority

In the heart of Amsterdam, PVH is home to the global headquarters of Tommy Hilfiger and the European offices of Calvin Klein.

  • Wellbeing: exclusive onsite gym and fitness classes, personal training, meditation studio, sports clubs, in-house physio, and receive access to our nutritional and wellbeing programs
  • Campus: extensive food and beverage offerings, top-notch restaurant, barista coffee bars, sky bar, monthly social events, weekly Thursday drinks, game nights, and campus-themed activities that will keep your social life busy
  • Develop your career: whether you lead a team or contribute your own expertise, everyone is a leader at PVH. PVH University curates and delivers training programs for you to continuously develop your professional and personal goals
  • Be at the forefront: stay closely connected to our brands, CALVIN KLEIN and TOMMY HILFIGER, and be a part of seasonal market launches, sample sales and receive employee discounts!

Check out our Amsterdam Campus here.

PVH Corp. or its subsidiary ("PVH") is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment on the basis of their individual capabilities and qualifications without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. In addition to complying with all applicable laws, PVH is also committed to ensuring that all current and future PVH associates are compensated solely on job-related factors such as skill, ability, educational background, work quality, experience and potential.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Wil je met jouw werk direct bijdragen aan een slimmere binnenvaart? Ter uitbreiding van ons team autonoom varen, zijn wij op zoek naar een ervaren machine learning engineer. Samen met je collega’s ben je verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling van onze autonome producten. Je bent van a tot z betrokken, van concept en ontwikkeling tot het testen en succesvol implementeren van nieuwe features. 


Dit zijn wij

Shipping Technology is een toonaangevende speler in de maritieme sector, gespecialiseerd in innovatieve technologische oplossingen voor de scheepvaartindustrie. Ons team bestaat uit gepassioneerde professionals die samen werken aan het verbeteren van de efficiëntie en duurzaamheid van de maritieme sector.

Dit ga je doen

  • Je verwerkt data van verschillende sensoren om een goede representatie van het schip en zijn omgeving te creëren;
  • Je ontwikkelt scheepsmodellen die het gedrag van het schip voorspellen;
  • Je bouwt modellen die het brandstofverbruik voorspellen;
  • Je ontwikkelt modules die de route planning voor het schip bepalen;
  • Je staat in contact met kapiteins om feedback op te halen en storingen te analyseren. Aan de hand van deze informatie zoek jij naar verbeteringen en stel je die natuurlijk voor;
  • Je werkt nauw samen met het technisch team, om samen tot de beste ontwikkelingen te komen van onze producten. Je directe collega’s zijn onze autonomy engineers, data engineers, Front End developers en UX-designer. 


Dit ben jij

Opleiding: Je hebt een afgeronde WO-opleiding in de richting van computer science, AI of een vergelijkbare opleiding;

Ervaring: Je hebt al minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in een software development omgeving. Je hebt kennis en ervaring met het deployen en managen van ML-modellen in productie. 

Vaardigheden:

  • Ruime ervaring met Python en SQL
  • Machine learning tools zoals: SK-learn en TensorFlow
  • Je hebt eerder gewerkt met Docker en GIT
  • Je bent bekend met signal processing technieken zoals Kalman filtering
  • Je hebt ervaring met MLops. 
  • Je bent eerder betrokken geweest bij het monitoren van prestaties, versiebeheer en het bijhouden van libraries;
  • Ervaring met een cloud platform zoals GCP of Azure is gewenst;
  • Eventueel heb je ervaring met CI/CD-tools. 

Persoonlijkheid: 

Je bent van jezelf erg nieuwsgierig en houdt ervan om jezelf continu uit te dagen. Je wordt enthousiast van het ophalen van feedback, om zo onze producten nog beter te kunnen maken. Het vertalen van complexe problemen naar simpele oplossingen is jou op je lijf geschreven. En natuurlijk ben je een gezellige, vrolijke collega die graag aan hetzelfde doel werkt als alle andere ST collega’s. Namelijk: Every Ship a Smart Ship!


Dit bieden wij jou

  • Een baan voor 40 uur per week;
  • Een marktconform salaris van max. € 6000 bruto per maand;
  • 25 vakantiedagen (mogelijkheid om vakantiedagen bij te kopen);
  • 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Pensioen met een werkgeversbijdrage van 7,5%;
  • NS Businesscard / Km vergoeding;
  • Een budget om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen;
  • Een regeling waarbij je zelf je laptop mag uitkiezen;
  • Een maandelijkse telefoonvergoeding en een thuiswerkvergoeding;
  • Dinsdag en donderdag zijn bij ons thuiswerkdagen. Op maandag, woensdag en vrijdag zorgen wij voor een gezellige gezamenlijke lunch op kantoor. 
  • Regelmatig een borrel en andere teamuitjes.

Title: Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Analytics

Rate: €70 per hour

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to design, implement, and maintain ML models for an advanced Data Analytics Platform. You will collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to deliver scalable, high-value ML solutions.

Your role:

Build and deploy scalable ML models (cloud & on-prem).
Perform data preprocessing, feature engineering, training, evaluation, and monitoring.
Apply MLOps, CI/CD, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and contribute to standards and frameworks.
Mentor junior colleagues.

Your profile:

Bachelor/Master in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.
5+ years of experience in machine learning/data science.
Proficient in Python and ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Experienced with Azure (GCP a plus).
Strong knowledge of MLOps, CI/CD, and production deployment.
Analytical, communicative, and value-driven mindset.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer | The Hague
Description:
About This Position

AI is transforming industries, but in critical environments, it must be reliable, scalable, and secure. At TNO, we develop AI-driven systems that interact with physical processes (sensors, actuators), and make autonomous decisions in complex, real-world scenarios—from adaptive energy grids and defence intelligence networks to biodiversity digital twins that support environmental policy. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will contribute to the research, development, and implementation of machine learning solutions that directly impact vital infrastructure. You will work with leading experts in AI, distributed systems, and software engineering to develop innovative applications that bridge the gap between fundamental research and practical deployment. Aspects such as assessing and improving system performance, safety, and controllability will be part of your work. The research group Intelligent Cyber-physical Systems Engineering (ICSE) is your home base. From Groningen and The Hague, more than 35 scientists, researchers, and consultants prove the added value of digital applications every day. You’ll also work closely with colleagues from other departments and units. ICSE is a great mix of highly qualified women and men with different levels of experience and of various nationalities. We all have a passion for applied research and we enjoy talking about it in an open and informal atmosphere we’re there for each other, support each other, and are open to your ideas!

What will be your role?

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be involved in the full lifecycle of Machine Learning solutions, from research and experimentation to building and deploying robust Machine Learning models and AI-based systems. Your role includes


Developing Machine Learning software that enhances autonomy in cyber-physical systems.
Building proof-of-concept applications and demonstrators that translate AI research into practical, scalable solutions.
Optimizing and deploying Machine learning models, ensuring performance, reliability, and efficiency.
Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams, including experts in AI, systems engineering, and domain-specific applications.
Exploring cutting-edge AI techniques and evaluating their real-world applicability in critical infrastructure and in when interacting with physical processes.
Work with customers and partners to solve new and existing problems using state-of-the-art Machine Learning technology.


Examples of currently running projects


AI Agents for Military Intelligence – Developing generative AI agents that assist analysts in filtering large-scale data for actionable insights.
GPT-NL [https //gpt-nl.nl/] – Contributing to data curation and training pipelines for the first large-scale, lawful Dutch AI language model.
Sustainable (re)manufacturing – AI-based decision support for optimizing handling of returned products.


What We Expect From You

You are an ambitious Machine Learning Engineer with a strong technical foundation and a passion for applying AI to real-world challenges. You have a passion for building reliable, safe, and performant digital products, and an open mind to work on a cross-expertise environment.

Other Knowledge And Skills You Bring To TNO


A PhD or master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
Strong collaboration and communication skills to work in multidisciplinary teams. A pro-active and independent work attitude.
Experience with Python, and a willingness to learn new programming languages and platforms like Rust, TypeScript, Java or Go. Knowledge of and preferably experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
An analytical mindset and curiosity to explore new AI techniques on the one hand, while keeping a critical and pragmatic perspective on the impact of AI on the other hand.


And one or more of the following


An understanding of software engineering principles, including MLOps, and DevOps. Experience with design and integration of distributed systems, monitoring, and data-processing systems.
A mathematical background on modelling (e.g. physical processes) and implementing these models in code.
An intrinsic interest in engineering phases such as design, validation and verification, lifecycle management, and system assessment. Preferably, experience with conceptual modelling techniques such as UML or SysML.


What You'll Get In Return

Challenging and varied work with a real impact. And plenty of opportunities as, at TNO, you are in charge of shaping your career. We offer a gross monthly salary between € 3,385 and € 5,000 (based on your knowledge and experience), 8% holiday pay, a 13th month bonus of 8.33% and a flex budget (5.58% + € 180). In addition, you will be given every opportunity to develop yourself.

Perhaps you would like to grow your career in the direction of commerce or consultancy? Or would you like to become a project manager? Immerse yourself in sustainable innovations? Or carve out a career as a technical expert?

TNO offers optional employee benefits, enabling you to tailor your benefits package to match your personal situation. You may also expect


An extremely professional, innovative working environment where colleagues are leading experts in their field.
The opportunity to attend courses, workshops and conferences, and to receive training and coaching based on your needs.
33 days annual leave on a full-time basis.
An employer that values and encourages diverse talent, with initiatives like the Female Leadership Program, our Rainbow Community and round tables on inclusion topics.
We offer a comprehensive and flexible mobility plan that also includes full compensation for public transportation for commuting and business travel.
Great social events with your team and other TNO colleagues . That’s how you will get to know a lot of people really quickly.
Flexible working hours, the possibility to work parttime (32 of 36 hours) and the possibility of working from home.
Access to our Talent Development Programme .
Networking opportunities and great activities organized by Jong TNO .
A good pension scheme.


Read More About Tailoring Your Benefits Package.

TNO as an employer

At TNO, we innovate for a healthier, safer and more sustainable life. And for a strong economy. Since 1932, we have been making knowledge and technology available for the common good. We find each other in wonder and ingenuity. We are driven to push boundaries. There is all the space and support for your talent and ambition. You work with people who will challenge you who inspire you and want to learn from you. Our state-of-the-art facilities are there to realize your vision. What you do at TNO matters impact makes the difference. Because with every innovation you contribute to tomorrow’s world. Read more about TNO as an employer .

At TNO we encourage an inclusive work environment, where you can be yourself. Whatever your story and whatever unique qualities you bring to the table. It is by combining our unique strengths and perspectives that we are able to develop innovations that make a real difference in society. Want to know more? Read what steps we are taking in the area of diversity, equity and inclusion .

The selection process

Please apply before the 7th of September, 2025. The selection process comprises two interview rounds. The preliminary interview takes place on the 18th of September, 2025. The second interview round has been scheduled for the 22nd of September, 2025. In a final meeting we will discuss the terms of employment and your tailored benefits package. We aim to finalize the entire process within four weeks.

The selection process may include an online assessment and a reference check.

A certificate of Conduct (VOG) is required before starting a new job at TNO.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
We at Lumion make beautiful, high-performance desktop software for architectural visualization. Think: gorgeous buildings, smooth lighting, slick renders — the works. Now, we’re on a mission to develop some AI enhancements on top.

We're not trying to build the next ChatGPT or reinvent neural networks. We just want to make our app smarter — with clever, useful, jaw-droppingly cool features — using the powerful AI models already out there in the wild. That’s where you come in.




What You’ll Actually Do

You're not a lab researcher. You're a feature whisperer who knows how to make AI do things. You'll use open-source models (diffusion, GANs, vision transformers, etc.), evaluate a few APIs, glue things together, and help our users get magical results with minimal clicks.




Here are some things we’re dreaming about:

Turn a crappy photo into a stunning material.
Auto-generate textures or assets with zero human suffering.
Help users get better renders faster with upscaling, denoising, smart defaults.
Integrate AI into creative workflows without making it feel like AI is taking over the world (yet).




We’re Looking for Someone Who:

Has experience working with AI/ML in real-world, non-academic settings
Knows how to wrangle pre-trained models (PyTorch, ONNX, Hugging Face, etc.)
Loves building things, not just running experiments
Can work in Python, and ideally isn’t afraid of C++ (or people who use it)
Understands that “AI-enhanced” should never mean “mysteriously broken”
Bonus: You’ve played with 3D software, graphics pipelines, or materials/textures




Why You Might Like It Here

No infra-heavy LLM nonsense — just real features for real users
Small team, high trust, low politics
Ownership from day one: prototype, iterate, ship
We’re allergic to buzzwords, but not allergic to shipping cool stuff
An attractive salary and bonus structure.
Full-time contract.
30 vacation days per year.
20 workation days to work remotely from anywhere.
Local Office Benefits: Free lunch and free office gym.
The opportunity to work in an enthusiastic, international team, in a creative environment, focused on people, growth, and collaboration.
Ideally, we'd love this person to be based in the Netherlands but we are open to remote as well.




Friendly note:

Please do not make use of this vacancy as an acquisition opportunity
