HTML:
Job Description

Zendesk’s people have one goal in mind: to make Customer Experience better. Our products help more than 125,000 global brands (AirBnb, Uber, JetBrains, Slack, among others) make their billions of customers happy, every day.

Our team is dedicated to providing a state-of-the-art retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) platform across multiple channels; including customer service bots, email and search. In collaboration with Software and ML Engineers, we deliver high-quality AI products leveraging the latest tools and techniques, and serve them at a scale that most companies can only dream of. We’re passionate about empowering end-users to quickly find answers to their questions, and helping our customers make the most of their knowledge base.

We’re looking for a Senior ML Scientist to join our team. You will collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and cross-functional teams to translate research into solutions directly impacting millions of support interactions. You will play a key role in levelling up the RAG platform powering Zendesk!

What you’ll be doing

  • Research, prototype, and develop state-of-the-art NLP/ML models for use cases to drive automated resolutions for end-user issues.
  • Design and execute rigorous experiments and evaluations (offline/online, A/B) to improve model accuracy and robustness.
  • Improve prompts and hyperparameters to optimize our state-of-the-art retrieval and generative capabilities
  • Work closely with ML Engineers to productionize ML solutions—including data pipelines, scalable model serving, and monitoring.
  • Analyze large, multi-lingual customer interaction datasets to uncover insights and power new solutions.
  • Participate in technical reviews and share knowledge of underlying ML methodologies and best practices.
  • Present your work to a multi-disciplinary, global audience.
  • Stay up to date with recent literature in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing (NLP) and share knowledge internally.
  • Champion initiatives to improve the quality and robustness of Zendesk AI capabilities.
  • Mentor junior scientists and help grow the ML research culture.

Key challenges / use cases

  • How do we enrich customer service conversations with accurate language detection and task classification, efficient retrieval and real-time conversation generation, to enable proactive customer engagement and optimal resolution?
  • How can we automate all customer service interactions as much as possible with omni-channel bots with a knowledge base?
  • How do we automate large-scale A/B testing and model evaluation (online and offline) to continually iterate and improve our RAG tools?
  • What novel approaches or architectures (e.g., retrieval-augmented generation, agentic, few-shot/fine-tuning strategies) can extend our conversational AI platforms to unlock new customer support use cases and modalities?
  • How do we efficiently operationalize, monitor, and update large-scale (LLM/ML) models in dynamic, high-throughput production settings, ensuring model health, drift detection, and continuous learning?
  • How do we combine signals from conversation context, customer history, and external data to improve prediction and decision accuracy across our ML services?
  • What are the emerging advancements in ML/AI research (e.g., large language models, efficient adaptation, re-ranking, retrieval, or explainable AI) that should be incorporated into Zendesk’s customer experience ecosystem?
  • How can we bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and impactful product features, rapidly validating ideas in production and quantifying their real-world business value?
  • And many more!

What you bring to the role

  • MSc degree (PhD preferred) in computer science, electrical engineering, math, or related areas.
  • Deep knowledge of ML theory, algorithms, and modern NLP/LLM techniques.
  • Demonstrated ability to conduct independent research and deliver production-grade ML solutions.
  • Strong coding skills in Python; experience with ML frameworks (preferably PyTorch).
  • Experience with large-scale experimentation (e.g., A/B testing), data analysis, and performance tracking.
  • Strong collaboration and communication abilities.
  • Be pragmatic and results oriented.

What our tech stack looks like

  • Our code is largely written in Python, with some parts in Ruby
  • Our platform is built on AWS
  • Our machine learning models rely on PyTorch
  • Our ML pipelines use AWS Batch and MetaFlow
  • Data is stored in RDS MySQL, Redis, S3, ElasticSearch, Kafka, and Athena
  • Services are deployed to Kubernetes using Docker, with Kafka for stream processing
  • Infrastructure health is monitored using Datadog and Sentry

What we offer

  • Team of passionate people who love what they do!
  • Exciting opportunity to work with LLMs and RAG (retrieval augmented generation), rapidly evolving fields in AI
  • Ownership of the product features at scale, making a significant impact for millions of customers
  • Opportunity to learn and grow!
  • Possibility to specialise in areas such as security, performance, and reliability
  • and everything you need to be effective and maintain work-life balance
  • Flexible working hours
  • Professional development funds
  • Comfortable office and a remote-friendly environment

About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you curious about modern software development and looking for your next challenge? At Deloitte Engineering, we are seeking recent graduates and candidates with up to two years of full-time experience in software engineering who want to take an active role in improving their technical and problem-solving competencies while growing our Engineering practice.




With more than 3,000 employees, Deloitte is the largest audit and consultancy firm in Denmark. We tailor solutions across Audit, Tax, Financial Advisory Services, Enterprise Risk Services, Technology, and Transformations.




About the team

We, the Engineering offering of Deloitte Technology & Transformation Denmark, are on the lookout for additional team players for our quickly growing practice of software engineers, architects, cloud consultants, and IT management consultants. We assist our clients, some of the largest companies, agencies, and organizations in Denmark and the Nordics, on the implementation of new cloud-native systems as part of their digital transformation, and we need you to help build their opportunities and meet their challenges!




Together, we will accelerate your career towards becoming a proficient software engineer. At Deloitte, we are committed to empowering you throughout your career development. As a new employee, you are assigned a talent manager to support your career aspirations and development. You will also be part of a tech community with monthly meetings in which we share knowledge, investigate new topics, and upskill within relevant technologies and methodologies.




Job Description

As a Junior Software Engineer in Deloitte Engineering, you will work with the full software lifecycle, all the way from architecting the solution and writing code to integrating and deploying the solution. You will work closely with both clients and internal stakeholders to ensure that our solutions meet their business needs and their technical requirements. Our client assignments can vary greatly, but common to all of them is that we strive to work with the technologies that the client prefers. Regardless of the technology, we provide you with the opportunity and tools needed to learn and grow within all of them.




In this role, you will make an impact by:

Developing applications and solutions of all sizes, frequently in Agile settings (SAFE/Scrum). This includes both backend and frontend development.
Assisting in designing and architecting solutions, often in a Cloud context.
Assisting in the implementation of CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and adopting DevOps practices to streamline development workflows.
Building internal capabilities through community tasks, maybe within new business areas.
Joining in on workshops, sales pitches, and contributing to proposals for new client projects.




Qualifications

You hold a Master’s degree, preferably with a focus on Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other relevant fields such as Information Technology or Software Design. You have either:

Recently graduated (or expect to graduate in the summer of 2025) and have relevant experience from part-time positions, utilizing your analytical and problem-solving skill set, or
You have up to two years of full-time experience in software engineering positions, preferably working closely with business stakeholders.




Furthermore, you are either a native Danish speaker or highly proficient in written and spoken Danish.

What you bring to the team:

Experience in Java, C#/.NET, JavaScript, TypeScript, or one or more other widely used programming languages.
Strong analytical skills, a focus on quality and detail, and a proven ability to solve problems in a structured way.
Preferably some experience with DevOps practices such as CI/CD, IaC, and test automation.
A positive, team-oriented mindset and a hunger for learning new technologies.
Excellent communication skills and an ability to express yourself clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.




Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.




What we can offer you

We highly appreciate the variation in knowledge, experience, and perspectives our consultants bring to the table. In exchange, we make sure that you develop professionally and are supported and encouraged to meet your career goals—for example, we offer our consultants:

Enrolment in the Consultant Academy, which is our training program for building the essential Consultant skills. The Academy takes you to exciting locations to learn from leading professionals in their respective fields.
Focused career development by assigning you a talent manager who acts as your mentor and guides you in your professional journey at Deloitte.
Continuous learning opportunities within Software Engineering, Cloud, and Agile Ways of Working, for example, through certification courses.
The opportunity to participate in projects and internal work with our different market offerings to find the right fit for you.




On the social aspect, Deloitte Technology & Transformation is second to none. We offer everything from various sports communities to dinners and parties all year round, as well as a yearly trip where all our colleagues come together off-site to create lasting memories. We have a strong culture and community in Engineering, and we support each other every day to make an impact with our clients and to promote our personal and professional development.




Additional Information




Do you want to be part of our team?




Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.




Send your application, CV, grade transcripts from both Bachelor’s and Master’s studies, and other relevant documents by 30.09.2025. We process applications and arrange interviews continually, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible.




Please note that it is a requirement to have a Danish work permit to be considered for this position.




Expected start date: 01.11.2025




Please do not hesitate to contact Sophus Benee Olsen at +45 30 93 61 88 if you have any questions about the position.




We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.

By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.




We look forward to connecting with you!




In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths – because that is how we can make a difference.

We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.

By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.


We look forward to connecting with you!


In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. Title: Staff Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
Job Description

Zendesk’s people have one goal in mind: to make Customer Experience better. Our products help more than 125,000 global brands (AirBnb, Uber, JetBrains, Slack, among others) make their billions of customers happy, every day.

Our team is dedicated to providing a state-of-the-art retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) platform across multiple channels; including customer service bots, email and search. In collaboration with Software and ML Engineers, we deliver high-quality AI products leveraging the latest tools and techniques, and serve them at a scale that most companies can only dream of. We’re passionate about empowering end-users to quickly find answers to their questions, and helping our customers make the most of their knowledge base.

As a Staff Machine Learning Scientist you are a recognized leader and domain expert, responsible for advancing the state-of-the-art in ML/AI for customer service at a global scale. You steer research vision, mentor scientists across teams, and drive adoption of foundational models powering Zendesk’s most impactful features.

What You’ll Be Doing


Lead end-to-end design, development, and deployment of novel ML/LLM models and algorithms—defining research agendas that shape Zendesk’s AI-powered roadmap.
Pioneer large, complex initiatives across product lines, such as building multilingual, real-time, conversational AI agents, and next-generation automated resolution solutions.
Define and drive experimentation standards, statistically robust offline/online evaluations, and model governance for compliance, fairness, and explainability.
Bridge cutting-edge research and production, collaborating with Engineering to build systems that scale globally and meet real-world performance constraints.
Mentor, guide, and develop Senior Scientists and Engineers, fostering a culture of scientific rigor, creativity, and technical excellence across the organization.
Advise leadership on ML/AI technology strategy and assess emerging industry trends for integration into Zendesk solutions.
Mentor junior scientists and help grow the ML research culture.


Key Challenges / Use Cases


How do we enrich customer service conversations with accurate language detection and task classification, efficient retrieval and real-time conversation generation, to enable proactive customer engagement and optimal resolution?
How can we automate all customer service interactions as much as possible with omni-channel bots with a knowledge base?
How do we automate large-scale A/B testing and model evaluation (online and offline) to continually iterate and improve our RAG tools?
What novel approaches or architectures (e.g., retrieval-augmented generation, agentic, few-shot/fine-tuning strategies) can extend our conversational AI platforms to unlock new customer support use cases and modalities?
How do we efficiently operationalize, monitor, and update large-scale (LLM/ML) models in dynamic, high-throughput production settings, ensuring model health, drift detection, and continuous learning?
How do we combine signals from conversation context, customer history, and external data to improve prediction and decision accuracy across our ML services?
What are the emerging advancements in ML/AI research (e.g., large language models, efficient adaptation, re-ranking, retrieval, or explainable AI) that should be incorporated into Zendesk’s customer experience ecosystem?
How can we bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and impactful product features, rapidly validating ideas in production and quantifying their real-world business value?
And many more!


What You Bring To The Role


MSc degree (PhD preferred) in computer science, electrical engineering, math, or related areas.
Substantial track record of impactful research and deployment of ML/AI solutions at scale—preferably in NLP, LLMs or information retrieval.
Proven technical and research leadership across projects/teams; ability to define research vision and influence organizational direction.
Deep expertise in experimental design, statistical analysis, and ML science best practices.
Strong coding skills in Python; experience with ML frameworks (preferably PyTorch).
Experience with large-scale experimentation (e.g., A/B testing), data analysis, and performance tracking.
Outstanding mentorship and communication skills—able to both advance scientific discourse and influence engineering/product execution.
Be pragmatic and results oriented.
Recognized contributions to the scientific community (publications, open source, talks) a strong plus.


What Our Tech Stack Looks Like


Our code is largely written in Python, with some parts in Ruby
Our platform is built on AWS
Our machine learning models rely on PyTorch
Our ML pipelines use AWS Batch and MetaFlow
Data is stored in RDS MySQL, Redis, S3, ElasticSearch, Kafka, and Athena
Services are deployed to Kubernetes using Docker, with Kafka for stream processing
Infrastructure health is monitored using Datadog and Sentry


What We Offer


Team of passionate people who love what they do!
Exciting opportunity to work with LLMs and RAG (retrieval augmented generation), rapidly evolving fields in AI
Ownership of the product features at scale, making a significant impact for millions of customers
Opportunity to learn and grow!
Possibility to specialise in areas such as security, performance, and reliability
and everything you need to be effective and maintain work-life balance
Flexible working hours
Professional development funds
Comfortable office and a remote-friendly environment


About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

What You Bring To The Role

  • MSc degree (PhD preferred) in computer science, electrical engineering, math, or related areas.
  • Substantial track record of impactful research and deployment of ML/AI solutions at scale—preferably in NLP, LLMs or information retrieval.
  • Proven technical and research leadership across projects/teams; ability to define research vision and influence organizational direction.
  • Deep expertise in experimental design, statistical analysis, and ML science best practices.
  • Strong coding skills in Python; experience with ML frameworks (preferably PyTorch).
  • Experience with large-scale experimentation (e.g., A/B testing), data analysis, and performance tracking.
  • Outstanding mentorship and communication skills—able to both advance scientific discourse and influence engineering/product execution.
  • Be pragmatic and results oriented.
  • Recognized contributions to the scientific community (publications, open source, talks) a strong plus.

What Our Tech Stack Looks Like

  • Our code is largely written in Python, with some parts in Ruby
  • Our platform is built on AWS
  • Our machine learning models rely on PyTorch
  • Our ML pipelines use AWS Batch and MetaFlow
  • Data is stored in RDS MySQL, Redis, S3, ElasticSearch, Kafka, and Athena
  • Services are deployed to Kubernetes using Docker, with Kafka for stream processing
  • Infrastructure health is monitored using Datadog and Sentry

What We Offer

  • Team of passionate people who love what they do!
  • Exciting opportunity to work with LLMs and RAG (retrieval augmented generation), rapidly evolving fields in AI
  • Ownership of the product features at scale, making a significant impact for millions of customers
  • Opportunity to learn and grow!
  • Possibility to specialise in areas such as security, performance, and reliability
  • and everything you need to be effective and maintain work-life balance
  • Flexible working hours
  • Professional development funds
  • Comfortable office and a remote-friendly environment

About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Title: Hearing Research Scientist
Description:
The audio team within RL Research is looking for a Research Scientist with a specialty in audio processing to join our growing team. You will be doing applied research and applied engineering in technologies that improve listener’s hearing abilities under challenging listening conditions alongside a team of dedicated research scientists, developers, and engineers. This role requires skills in signal processing for hearing enhancement and a passion for improving users’ ability to experience the world around them. In this position, you will collaborate closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, research scientists, and designers to develop novel hearing enhancement technologies. You will focus on designing and integrating state-of-the-art hearing enhancement algorithms to AR/VR products to create new experiences beyond what traditional consumer devices are capable of.

Hearing Research Scientist Responsibilities:


Research and design DSP and ML solutions for hearing features such as Conversation Focus and Hearing Correction on smart glasses. The work may include using both signal processing & ML techniques to solve problems in hearing enhancement (dynamic range compression, feedback management, adaptive filtering, noise suppression, dereverberation etc) and speech enhancement (adaptive beamforming, ML noise suppression, voice detection)
The key focus in this role is to bring previous experience of developing such solutions for hearing aids or other hearables and apply such experience to the smart glasses form factor
Design and implement hearing enhancement algorithms for wearable audio devices
Develop solutions that solve complex problems at the intersection between beamforming, machine learning, acoustics and signal processing for applications in AR/VR
Develop algorithms that meet system-level acoustic, compute, and memory constraints for wearable audio devices
Collaborate with teams in the larger Reality Labs audio team to deploy new technologies in AR/VR products


Minimum Qualifications:


3+ years experience developing, implementing and evaluating algorithm and signal processing techniques for audio processing
3+ years experience in programming in C++, MATLAB, or Python
Experience with cross-group collaboration


Preferred Qualifications:


Expertise in hearing enhancement signal processing and auditory perception
2+ years of experience in speech, hearing and audio perception research & technology development
3+ years experience developing, implementing and evaluating algorithm and signal processing techniques for speech enhancement solutions
Experience with application of machine learning techniques to speech enhancement algorithms
Experience and proven track record of developing and productizing speech enhancement solutions


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Staff Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
Job Description

The AI Agents org is revolutionizing the chatbot and voice assistance landscape with Gen3, a cutting-edge AI Agent system that is pushing the boundaries of conversational AI. Gen3 is not your typical chatbot; it's a goal-oriented, dynamic, and truly conversational system capable of reasoning, planning, and adapting to user needs in real-time. By leveraging a multi-agent architecture and advanced language models, Gen3 delivers personalized and engaging user experiences, moving beyond scripted interactions to handle complex tasks and "off-script" inquiries with ease.

We are delighted to be hiring a Staff Machine Learning Scientist for the AI Agent product at Zendesk. This is an exciting opportunity for a senior-level leader to not only bridge the gap between cutting-edge ML research and real-world impact but to actively define that bridge. You will play a pivotal role in shaping our product vision through bottom-up innovation, rapid prototyping, and the establishment of best practices. You'll have the freedom to discover and champion new product ideas, mentor junior scientists, and work alongside a talented cross-functional team to build the world’s most advanced AI agents in CX.

Key Responsibilities


Pioneer Product Vision and Innovation: You will partner closely with product managers and other stakeholders to discover and define the product roadmap. You'll champion bottom-up innovation, bringing forward novel ideas and research to influence the team's strategic direction.
Lead Rapid Prototyping: You will own the full research and development lifecycle from end-to-end, translating business requirements into technical designs. This includes the rapid implementation and testing of hypotheses using suitable tools and technologies to quickly validate solutions for future production.
Standardize Research and Evaluation: You will establish and evangelize research standards and best practices for the evaluation of our AI agents, ensuring consistency and rigor in how we measure success.
Mentor and Enable the Team: You will act as a force multiplier, mentoring other scientists and engineers, and enabling them to tackle complex challenges. You will also help non-technical stakeholders, like Product Managers, better understand the technical landscape.
Drive End-to-End Projects: You will own complex, designated product areas, guiding the team through the full research project lifecycle, from initial ideation to implementation, experimentation, and reporting.
Stay at the Forefront of Research: You will keep up with the latest advancements in the NLP and ML fields, introducing new concepts and literature as potential solutions to our business problems.
Collaborate and Peer Review: You will regularly discuss and peer-review research ideas with your colleagues, contributing to a culture of shared learning and continuous improvement.


Who You Are


A Proven Innovator: You have a strong track record of Machine Learning or NLP research, ideally in a senior industry role. You are known for not just solving problems, but for identifying and framing them.
Expert in Deep Learning: You have deep knowledge of building deep learning neural network architectures, with a focus on NLP. You can implement complex ideas from research literature into robust proof-of-concept models.
Experienced with Generative AI: You have significant experience with LLMs, Prompt Engineering, and AI Agent Context Management. Experience with conversational AI and voice technologies, including text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-speech (STS), is a huge bonus.
A Collaborative Leader: You have a positive, proactive, and team-oriented mindset. You are passionate about your craft and are keen to take part in product discussions. You care deeply about helping others succeed and have great communication skills.
The Right Qualifications: You hold a degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.


How We Measure Success


Strategic Impact: Your work directly influences and aligns with the overall product roadmap and strategic goals.
Mentorship and Team Growth: Your ability to mentor and enable others demonstrably improves the team's capabilities and output.
Bottom-Up Innovation: Your ability to identify new opportunities and champion these ideas leads to tangible improvements in our products.
Research Standardization: The research evaluation frameworks you establish are widely adopted and improve the quality and rigor of our work.
Collaboration: Your effectiveness in collaborating with product managers, engineers, designers, and other stakeholders helps bridge technical and non-technical gaps.


The Interview Process

We are excited to learn more about you, so we want to be transparent about what you can expect from our interview process:


Initial Call with Talent Team - 15 mins
Interview with one member of the Hiring Team - 45 minutes
Take-home technical/research challenge
A technical interview with two of our scientists to talk more in-depth about your technical experience and answer any questions you might have - 1 hour
Final interview with 2 of the following: CTO or Engineering Manager/Director - 45 minutes


About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: AI Engineer - The Flex Europe
Description:
About The Flex

The Flex is on a mission to transform the global rental sector. We believe that renting a home should be as seamless as buying from Amazon. Our platform empowers tenants to rent anywhere in the world effortlessly, while providing landlords with hassle-free property management—without excessive fees. We are assembling a world-class team of ambitious, growth-minded individuals ready to scale The Flex into a global leader. We reward initiative and promote from within.

Position Summary

As an AI Engineer, you will be at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence into The Flex’s systems. You’ll build, deploy, and optimize AI-driven tools and models that support operations, customer experience, automation, and decision-making. This is a high-impact role with the potential to shape the future of tech in the real estate industry.

Key Responsibilities


AI & ML Development: Build and train machine learning models for use cases like pricing optimization, Property Management Tools.
LLM Integration: Develop and integrate LLM-powered features (e.g., GPT APIs) into internal tools and customer-facing products.
Automation: Leverage AI to automate repetitive internal tasks, enhance support, and improve user experience.
Deployment: Package and deploy models into production using modern MLOps tools and cloud infrastructure (preferably AWS).
Collaboration: Work closely with engineers, product managers, and operations teams to identify and implement impactful AI opportunities.
Documentation & Maintenance: Ensure reproducibility, versioning, and continuous improvement of all AI models and pipelines.


What We’re Looking For


Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset.
Clear communication and a collaborative attitude.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, remote-first startup environment.


Why Join The Flex?


Join an innovative company revolutionizing the real estate and hospitality space.
Play a key role in building AI products from the ground up.
Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
Growth-oriented culture with fast career progression.
Work remotely with a flexible schedule and a dynamic team.


You Should Not Apply If


You are looking for a traditional corporate 9 to 5 job.
You engage in office politics or gossip.
You want a slow-paced role with no growth.
You do not strive to be world-class at what you do.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
Job Description

The Agentic Tribe is revolutionizing the chatbot and voice assistance landscape with Gen3, a cutting-edge AI Agent system that's pushing the boundaries of conversational AI. Gen3 is not your typical chatbot; it's a goal-oriented, dynamic, and truly conversational system capable of reasoning, planning, and adapting to user needs in real-time. By leveraging a multi-agent architecture and advanced language models, Gen3 delivers personalized and engaging user experiences, moving beyond scripted interactions to handle complex tasks and "off-script" inquiries with ease.

We are delighted to be hiring a Senior Machine Learning Scientist for the AI Agent product at Zendesk. You will own a designated product area and revolutionize how our customers experience our products. This is an exciting opportunity to bridge the gap between cutting-edge ML research and real-world impact. You'll have the freedom to shape the product roadmap, discover innovative ML applications, and collaborate with a talented cross-functional team.

Key Responsibilities


You'll be part of a team responsible for designing and testing novel AI solutions for real business problems
You'll own the full research projects end-to-end from understanding business requirements to design, implementation, experimentation and reporting
You'll discuss your and others ideas in the research team regularly and provide peer review for your colleagues work
You'll keep up with the NLP and ML fields and literature and introduce new concepts discovered as potential solutions to our business problems
You'll work closely with machine learning engineers helping them implement your designs into our production system
You'll use suitable tools and technologies for rapid implementation and quickly testing your hypotheses while keeping in mind the requirements of future production implementation
You’ll collaborate with Product managers and other non technical stakeholders to discover product roadmap.


Who You Are


Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.
Proven record of Machine Learning or NLP research, ideally in industry.
Knowledge of building deep learning neural network architectures, ideally with focus on NLP.
Ability to implement ideas from research literature into proof-of-concept models.
Practical approach for researching machine learning solutions to business problems.
Huge bonus if you have experience with conversational AI.
A positive, pro-active team player who is passionate about their craft, is keen to take part in product discussions and cares about helping the team deliver.
Great communication skill and fluency in English.


How do we measure success in this role?


How well your work aligns with the overall product roadmap and strategic goals.
Effectiveness in collaborating with product managers, engineers, designers, and other stakeholders
Discovery and Ideation - ability to identify new opportunities within the product area, as well as their ability to prioritize and champion these ideas.

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

Hybrid: In this role, our hybrid experience is designed at the team level to give you a rich onsite experience packed with connection, collaboration, learning, and celebration - while also giving you flexibility to work remotely for part of the week. This role must attend our local office for part of the week. The specific in-office schedule is to be determined by the hiring manager.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.


Show more
HTML:
Job Description

The Agentic Tribe is revolutionizing the chatbot and voice assistance landscape with Gen3, a cutting-edge AI Agent system that's pushing the boundaries of conversational AI. Gen3 is not your typical chatbot; it's a goal-oriented, dynamic, and truly conversational system capable of reasoning, planning, and adapting to user needs in real-time. By leveraging a multi-agent architecture and advanced language models, Gen3 delivers personalized and engaging user experiences, moving beyond scripted interactions to handle complex tasks and "off-script" inquiries with ease.

We are delighted to be hiring a Senior Machine Learning Scientist for the AI Agent product at Zendesk. You will own a designated product area and revolutionize how our customers experience our products. This is an exciting opportunity to bridge the gap between cutting-edge ML research and real-world impact. You'll have the freedom to shape the product roadmap, discover innovative ML applications, and collaborate with a talented cross-functional team.

Key Responsibilities

  • You'll be part of a team responsible for designing and testing novel AI solutions for real business problems
  • You'll own the full research projects end-to-end from understanding business requirements to design, implementation, experimentation and reporting
  • You'll discuss your and others ideas in the research team regularly and provide peer review for your colleagues work
  • You'll keep up with the NLP and ML fields and literature and introduce new concepts discovered as potential solutions to our business problems
  • You'll work closely with machine learning engineers helping them implement your designs into our production system
  • You'll use suitable tools and technologies for rapid implementation and quickly testing your hypotheses while keeping in mind the requirements of future production implementation
  • You’ll collaborate with Product managers and other non technical stakeholders to discover product roadmap.

Who You Are

  • Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.
  • Proven record of Machine Learning or NLP research, ideally in industry.
  • Knowledge of building deep learning neural network architectures, ideally with focus on NLP.
  • Ability to implement ideas from research literature into proof-of-concept models.
  • Practical approach for researching machine learning solutions to business problems.
  • Huge bonus if you have experience with conversational AI.
  • A positive, pro-active team player who is passionate about their craft, is keen to take part in product discussions and cares about helping the team deliver.
  • Great communication skill and fluency in English.

How do we measure success in this role?

  • How well your work aligns with the overall product roadmap and strategic goals.
  • Effectiveness in collaborating with product managers, engineers, designers, and other stakeholders
  • Discovery and Ideation - ability to identify new opportunities within the product area, as well as their ability to prioritize and champion these ideas.

About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

Hybrid: In this role, our hybrid experience is designed at the team level to give you a rich onsite experience packed with connection, collaboration, learning, and celebration - while also giving you flexibility to work remotely for part of the week. This role must attend our local office for part of the week. The specific in-office schedule is to be determined by the hiring manager.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Kan du omsætte komplekse forretningsudfordringer til målbare AI-løsninger?




Som Senior Data Scientist i Inspari er du med fra idé til implementering af AI modeller – og sikrer, at de skaber reel værdi for enterprise-kunder inden for retail, utilities og manufacturing. Du bliver betroet rådgiver, sparringspartner for forretningen og mentor for yngre kolleger.




Hvis du vil kombinere din erfaring med Data Science og værdiskabelse med et miljø, hvor ejerskab, samarbejde og Heartwork er drivkraften, så er dette rollen for dig.




Din hverdag i Inspari

Du bliver en del af forretningsenheden AI, Automation & Apps, som består af 18-20 specialister, der arbejder med de nyeste teknologier for at skabe markedets bedste løsninger.




Som Senior Data Scientist bliver du en del af vores AI-team, hvor vi kombinerer dyb teknisk viden med forretningsforståelse og tæt kundesamarbejde.




Vi brænder for at drive datadrevet transformation for vores enterprisekunder bl.a. inden for retail, utilities & manufacturing. Vi fokuserer på at optimere processer og skabe målbare resultater gennem banebrydende AI- og Data Science-løsninger.




Vi tror på at give vores teams ejerskab og ansvar som selvstændige konsulenter. Vores projekter spænder fra at optimere forsyningskæder til at forbedre kundeoplevelser – alle med avancerede Data Science- og AI-teknikker som omdrejningspunkt.







Din rolle og tilhørende ansvar

Som Senior Data Scientist får du en central rolle i at forme og levere avancerede løsninger til vores enterprisekunder. Du vil samarbejde tæt med kundernes interessenter for at forstå deres processer, identificere optimeringsmuligheder og implementere modeller og strategier, der skaber forretningsværdi.




Som erfaren konsulent vil din rolle være at drive alle faser i data science-projekter. Det indebærer b.la.:

Samarbejde med vores enterprisekunder om at identificere og forstå deres forretningsmæssige udfordringer.
Designe og implementere machine learning-modeller, algoritmer og datadrevne strategier for at optimere processer og styrke beslutningstagning.
Omsætte komplekse dataindsigter til konkrete anbefalinger for ikke-tekniske interessenter.
Lede projektteams og sikre rettidig levering af løsninger i høj kvalitet.
Agere som betroet rådgiver og guide kunder på deres datadrevne transformationsrejse.
Være mentor for yngre teammedlemmer og fremme en kultur for læring og vækst.
Ansvar for eget budget og bidrage til teamets udvikling og vækst.







Dine kvalifikationer

Vi ønsker os, at du har:

Erfaring: Minimum 5 års erfaring inden for data science eller lignende, gerne fra konsulent- eller enterprisevirksomheder.
Teknisk ekspertise: Erfaring med MLOps/DevOps, Forecasting og GenAI. Solid erfaring med Python-programmering. Kendskab til vores primære biblioteker som Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, scikit-learn og Dash er en fordel. Grundlæggende viden om Cloud-tjenester som Microsoft Azure, Azure ML, Databricks, Data Lake og Blob.
Forretningsforståelse: Evne til at forstå og optimere forretningsprocesser inden for retail, utility eller manufacturing.
Konsulentfærdigheder: Stærke kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner samt erfaring med kundekontakt.
Selvstændighed: Evne til at arbejde selvstændigt og lede projekter fra ide til levering.




Bemærk venligst: Hvis ovenstående lyder interessant, og du kommer med relevant erfaring til at løfte ansvaret og opgaverne, så vil vi meget gerne undersøge dine muligheder hos os.







"I Inspari har vi et helt fantastisk godt fællesskab. Vi er dygtige til at støtte hinanden og skabe stærke samarbejder. Jeg værdsætter især det tætte samarbejde med vores kunder, hvor vi sammen formår at opnå en dyb forståelse og finde de rette løsninger i fællesskab. Vi har desuden nogle virkelig gode teamarrangementer, og der sker konstant spændende ting her."

- Emil Eriksen, Principal Data Scientist, Inspari







Din tjekliste

Generelt er du godt på vej, hvis du tilmed kan genkende dig selv i nedenstående linjer:

Du er passioneret omkring nye teknologier orienteret mod Data Science & AI
Du motiveres af at rådgive og lave tekniske løsninger for vores kunder, der optimerer deres dagligdag
Du stortrives i arbejdet med at indsamle og klargøre data, som du kan analysere, modellere og formidle
Du inspirerers af at indgå og bidrage i et fagligt fakultet, hvor vi i fællesskab løfter hinandens kompetenceniveau til fordel for kunder lige så vel vores egen trivsel
Du er ambitiøs og kan lide en dynamisk arbejdsuge, hvor du får en bred eksponering til kunder og forskellige løsninger
Du har lyst til at fortælle vidt og bredt om de mange muligheder, der åbner sig inden for DS/AI i disse år







Hvad vi tilbyder

Et dynamisk og samarbejdsorienteret arbejdsmiljø med fokus på innovation og effekt.
Mulighed for at arbejde på forskellige projekter med stor betydning for førende enterprisevirksomheder.
En stærk kultur for faglig udvikling med adgang til træning, mentorordninger og karriereudvikling.
Konkurrencedygtig løn og attraktive personalegoder.
At blive en del af vores unikke Heartwork kultur hvor ambitioner og forventninger går hånd i hånd med passion og holdånd.







Lokation: Du tilknyttes vores kontor i Kongens Lyngby eller Lystrup (ved Århus) med en hybrid arbejdsmodel.




Rejseaktivitet: Du skal forvente, at der kan være en vis rejseaktivitet.







Kontakt os snarest muligt

Send os dit CV og en motiveret ansøgning.




Vi glæder os til at høre om et projekt, hvor du har skabt målbare forretningsresultater gennem data science-teknikker.

Søg stillingen i Lyngby

Søg stillingen i Lystrup




Har du spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at række ud til:




Steffen Krogsgaard (Rekrutteringsansvarlig), +45 61 95 67 25

Kristina Kjær Hedegaard (Ansættende leder), +45 61 95 67 09

Show more

Title: ML/AI Engineer - Tax Automation & Agentic Platform
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.

We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

About The Job

At the EY’s digital product organization, you will be building intelligent tax automation tools and agentic AI platforms for increased efficiency, quality, and joy in tax and compliance workflows.

We help thousands of clients with services such as producing correct and compliant tax filings, and consulting multinational companies on how to navigate the international tax landscape.

To do those jobs with the highest degree of accuracy and efficiency, intelligent automation and great AI-powered software play key roles.

We operate across the Nordics (DK, FI, SE, NO) with a small, flat, and informal organization of ~40 engineers, designers, researchers, and PMs. In a distributed setup across all countries where we work from home and offices depending on preferences and needs.

Tax? Yes, tax filings and tax law are the domains we design and build for, so having an interest in those areas would be good. Actual experience and domain knowledge is of course a plus, but certainly not a requirement. It's a pretty small Venn diagram of ML engineers who also have professional tax experience.

Above all, we value working with good all-round people. People who are both highly specialized but are capable of collaborating across disciplines.

About You

As an ML/AI engineer, you will be entrusted with building intelligent automation systems and agentic AI platforms across several business-critical tax products.

As a master of your craft, you will develop production-ready ML models, NLP pipelines, and AI agents using Python, Langchain, and modern transformer architectures.

Solutions that are well-tested, documented, optimized for performance, and easy to maintain.

You have honed those skills by working on ML applications in cross-functional product teams, where you have shown yourself as a wonderful collaborator who can translate business requirements into intelligent technical solutions.

You have likely also done many model reviews and taken initiative to question AI approaches suggested by people more senior in the company than yourself. And challenged product decisions that didn't make technical sense from an ML perspective.

If that sounds like you, we should talk. In the meantime, here's more information about the work and our team.

Your Key Responsibilities


Building intelligent tax automation systems using ML/AI technologies
Developing agentic AI platforms for Nordic tax regulations and compliance
Close collaboration with tax professionals, designers, product managers, and fellow engineers
Spending time, occasionally, with users and domain experts to understand tax workflows in detail
Working across a range of products and problem spaces in the tax domain
Freedom to work remotely or in our Copenhagen or Stockholm office


Skills And Attributes For Success

To qualify for the role, you should have:


ML/AI Fundamentals: Experience with supervised/unsupervised learning, classification, entity extraction, document processing, and time-series analysis
NLP Expertise: Proficiency with transformer models, embeddings, document analysis, and Named Entity Recognition
Python Stack: Strong experience with Langchain, Ragas, OpenAI API, and modern ML frameworks
Production Experience: 2+ years deploying ML models as REST APIs with async processing capabilities
Database Skills: Experience with MongoDB and vector databases, particularly for document and financial data modeling
Cloud Platforms: Familiarity with Azure AI Foundry or similar cloud ML platforms
Security Awareness: Understanding of data privacy, security requirements, and compliance frameworks (SOX, PCI)
Easy access to Copenhagen, Helsinki, or Stockholm. You can work remotely most of the time, but we meet up in person weekly
Really good English speaking and writing skills. That's our work language
An interest in tax law and financial regulations


What We Look For

We obviously want you to be a skilled ML engineer, but we believe that a engineer is so much more than that. We are looking for a colleague who is…


A real craftsperson and a stickler for technical details
Delightful to be around and able to communicate ML concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A clear communicator who can translate between tax domain experts and technical teams
Supportive and helpful in cross-functional collaboration
Quick to solve complex problems with practical engineering solutions
Questioning AI approaches and decisions before committing to implementation
Eager to learn about both advancing ML techniques and tax domain complexities
Comfortable working in 6-week Shape Up cycles with autonomous project ownership


What We Offer


A tech product team: Digital product organization as a unit operates mostly product- and user-driven, even though we are situated within a large consultancy organization
Direct access to domain experts: Your ML models will directly impact tax professionals who are quite literally right next to you, providing immediate feedback and domain insights
Cutting-edge AI challenges: Work on agentic AI platforms and intelligent automation in a regulated, high-stakes environment
Shape Up methodology: Work in focused 6-week cycles with clear scope and autonomy
Good food and good times: We take good care of the people who dedicate their working hours to our cause
Diverse and inclusive culture: You'll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs


To learn more about EY and what it's like to work here, please follow us on EY Careers, Career blog and social media.

Apply now

Please apply with your CV and Cover Letter. We review applications on a continuous basis so please apply right away, but no later than 11.8.2025. For questions regarding the role, do not hesitate to contact brian.groth@dk.ey.com For any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Jakob.Damsted@dk.ey.com.

We look forward to your application.

At EY, we’ll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. We’ll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more.

Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.

To help create an equitable and inclusive experience during the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible about any disability-related adjustments or accommodations you may need.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.
Show more

Skills And Attributes For Success

To qualify for the role, you should have:

  • ML/AI Fundamentals: Experience with supervised/unsupervised learning, classification, entity extraction, document processing, and time-series analysis
  • NLP Expertise: Proficiency with transformer models, embeddings, document analysis, and Named Entity Recognition
  • Python Stack: Strong experience with Langchain, Ragas, OpenAI API, and modern ML frameworks
  • Production Experience: 2+ years deploying ML models as REST APIs with async processing capabilities
  • Database Skills: Experience with MongoDB and vector databases, particularly for document and financial data modeling
  • Cloud Platforms: Familiarity with Azure AI Foundry or similar cloud ML platforms
  • Security Awareness: Understanding of data privacy, security requirements, and compliance frameworks (SOX, PCI)
  • Easy access to Copenhagen, Helsinki, or Stockholm. You can work remotely most of the time, but we meet up in person weekly
  • Really good English speaking and writing skills. That's our work language
  • An interest in tax law and financial regulations

What We Look For

We obviously want you to be a skilled ML engineer, but we believe that a engineer is so much more than that. We are looking for a colleague who is…

  • A real craftsperson and a stickler for technical details
  • Delightful to be around and able to communicate ML concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  • A clear communicator who can translate between tax domain experts and technical teams
  • Supportive and helpful in cross-functional collaboration
  • Quick to solve complex problems with practical engineering solutions
  • Questioning AI approaches and decisions before committing to implementation
  • Eager to learn about both advancing ML techniques and tax domain complexities
  • Comfortable working in 6-week Shape Up cycles with autonomous project ownership

What We Offer

  • A tech product team: Digital product organization as a unit operates mostly product- and user-driven, even though we are situated within a large consultancy organization
  • Direct access to domain experts: Your ML models will directly impact tax professionals who are quite literally right next to you, providing immediate feedback and domain insights
  • Cutting-edge AI challenges: Work on agentic AI platforms and intelligent automation in a regulated, high-stakes environment
  • Shape Up methodology: Work in focused 6-week cycles with clear scope and autonomy
  • Good food and good times: We take good care of the people who dedicate their working hours to our cause
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You'll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs

To learn more about EY and what it's like to work here, please follow us on EY Careers, Career blog and social media.

Apply now

Please apply with your CV and Cover Letter. We review applications on a continuous basis so please apply right away, but no later than 11.8.2025. For questions regarding the role, do not hesitate to contact brian.groth@dk.ey.com For any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Jakob.Damsted@dk.ey.com.

We look forward to your application.

At EY, we’ll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. We’ll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more.

Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.

To help create an equitable and inclusive experience during the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible about any disability-related adjustments or accommodations you may need.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

Title: Computer Vision Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern c omputer v ision techniques.

As a Computer Vision Developer you will develop new features to our existing products that help improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to our user’s problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid software engineering foundation from a bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering or IT. Master’s degree with specialization in computer vision, robotics, or machine learning is a plus.
Have hands-on experience with software development using C++ and Python. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement. Knowledge of C# is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Have machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our products .

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Talent Aquisition Specialist, Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
