Title: Engineering Internship
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Shure Scandinavia, we offer internships within different engineering disciplines and we are always on the outlook for talented students, who are passionate about their field of study.

As an intern at Shure, you will be part of the professional team of developers who are passionate about technologies, innovation and product quality. We are eager to share knowledge and to learn from each other - both locally and with our colleagues in the US, India, Scotland and China.

Inclusion, trust and respect for one another is at the core of our robust company culture, and we have a dynamic and open work environment with lots of opportunities for learning and development. Our workplace is inspiring, flexible, and informal with ample possibilities for learning and growth. Shure is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and cherish inclusion in the workplace.

Responsibilities

Embedded Software

If your passion lies within C, C++ and Python, we can offer you a challenging internship during which you will contribute to the development of new product features and solutions including task estimation, design, implementation and documentation. Our embedded software department spans the globe and you will be part of a knowledgeable team of professional developers.

Application Software

Are you into working with HTML5, CSS, .net, and JavaScript as well as frameworks such as AngularJS and Material Design, then you can as a part of your internship contribute to developing great functionalities to Shure’s growing portfolio of software applications.

Digital Signal Processing

As an intern within Digital Signal Processing, you will be given assignments within design, simulation, development and test of real time audio signal processing algorithms for fixed-and-floating-point DSPs. Also, you will be making simulations in Matlab and Simulink as well as using C, C++ and DSP assembly languages.

FPGA

An internship within FPGA and Integrated Circuits Design will include design and coordination of FPGA circuits with use of VHDL for implementation of core signal processing and control elements as well as interfaces to other hardware. In addition hereto, you will be doing circuits test and analysis.

DevOps

If you like automation, you can help Shure to deliver faster by automating repetitive tasks. In DevOps, we help teams deliver firmware, software and data by streamlining our build set-up. We use Jenkins, Git (Bitbucket), Python 3.4+, Linux and Docker as well as PostgreSQL and Windows, and we visualize data using Grafana that enables our colleagues to make data driven decisions.

System Verification

Do you believe artificial intelligence and machine learning are the way forward for automation? Then we can offer you a challenging internship where you will be part of a team that strives to use automation for collecting data points to evaluate the health of our products and ecosystems on a global level.

Qualifications

Your profile and application:

As a person, you are focused and have an eye for detail. You see opportunities in the challenges that occur during your work day you and you enjoy collaborating with team members from different parts of the world. Shure is a global company and we have many talented developers who are always ready to review and discuss new ideas, methods and solutions. Ignite the pure power of engineering: Join Shure and have a great internship.

At Shure, in addition to practical experience, you receive salary during your internship.

When you apply, please tell us why you are interested in an Internship at Shure and remember to include an overview of the courses - including grades - you have completed. Pleae also include information on when you expect to start your internship according to your studies.
Show more

Title: Data & AI Platform Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in one of the most interesting challenges in Data Engineering in 2025: Crafting a Data & AI platform that makes creating and using data products a seamless and fast experience. We provide the platform for teams across consumer engagement, supply chain, finance, merchandising, and manufacturing domains to build data, analytics, and AI products for the world's largest jewellery company. As a Data & AI Platform Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining the infrastructure and platform essential for scaling our data impact across the organization. Your contribution will be pivotal in creating a secure and private data platform, delivering SDKs that speed up data product deliveries, ensuring seamless creation of resources, and creating robust automated deployment flows.

Key Responsibilities


Build and maintain platform services, shared libraries, and components that power the Data & AI platform.
Implement and support AI/GenAI service deployments (model endpoints, vector databases, feature stores) under established guardrails.
Automate resource provisioning and access patterns to make data products quick to create and easy to consume.
Develop integrations across batch, streaming, and ML/AI workloads using approved patterns and data contracts.
Build CI/CD pipelines, tests, and release automations for data pipelines and ML workloads; improve developer experience.
Configure and operate DevOps tooling (IaC, secrets, orchestration, observability); create useful dashboards and alerts.
Collaborate with stakeholders to refine requirements; write clear documentation and participate in demos and support rotations.



Your Skills & Background


Solid experience delivering end-to-end systems as a Data/Platform/MLOps/DevOps Engineer.
Strong software engineering skills in distributed, multi-language environments and collaborative code practices.
Fluency in Python and experience shipping production-grade services or pipelines.
Hands-on with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform) and reusable modules/patterns.
Experience with cloud data systems: Databricks/Spark, SQL/NoSQL stores, object storage, and data lake/lakehouse concepts.
Ability to build API-based integrations and contribute to platform SDKs or internal tooling.
Familiarity with one or more workflow/orchestration tools (Airflow, Databricks Workflows, Prefect, or Dagster).
Working knowledge of CI/CD, automated testing, and release engineering for data and ML workloads.
Basic security and privacy practices (IAM, secrets management, network basics) and willingness to deepen expertise.
Exposure to observability (Prometheus, Grafana, New Relic, ELK) and data quality/lineage tooling.
Awareness of FinOps principles and an interest in building cost-efficient solutions.
Effective communication, documentation, and collaboration with cross-functional partners.



Education & Experience


2–6 years experience building production-quality software & data products.
Bachelors or Masters degree and/or equivalent professional experience



Did we get your attention?    

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.    

Icing on the cake    

Pandora is the world’s largest jewellery brand, specializing in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Recognised by the Financial Times as one of Europe’s Best Workplaces and ranked #1 among Danish companies, Pandora is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe reflecting the diversity of society in how we engage with our customers is essential to fulfilling our purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Senior AI Engineer to join the AI CoE in ROCKWOOL HQ in Hedehusene. In this job, you can expect to travel about 10% of the time in support of global projects.

Ready to help build a better future for generations to come?

In an ever-changing, fast paced world, we owe it to ourselves and our future generations to live life responsibly. At ROCKWOOL, we work relentlessly to enrich modern living through our innovative stone wool solutions.

Your future team

We have recently started a journey towards using AI at scale, general digitalization, automation and better use of data – and this is where your abilities come into play. You will join the AI CoE team and work at the forefront of AI and machine learning. This role reports to the Manager of the AI CoE based in Hedehusene. You will work closely with teams from Denmark, Poland and Malaysia and be an integral part of a larger global Data & AI team.

What You Will Be Doing

We are seeking a talented and experienced Senior AI Engineer with Machine Learning, Generative AI and software development experience. In this role, you will work closely with Data Scientists, ML engineers, Data Engineers and cross-functional stakeholders to design, develop and deploy custom AI products and analytics solutions at ROCKWOOL. You will be part of a growing team that focuses on developing custom AI products & LLM solutions. The role requires a blend of technical and communication skills. More concretely, you will have the following responsibilities :

Develop and deploy AI products & applications


Use various modern technologies, tools and packages such as Azure OpenAI, LLMs, vector databases, Langchain etc. to engineer AI products at scale
Maintain custom GenAI products such as in house developed LLM solutions
Develop and maintain various LLM APIs and backend functionality that supports custom AI products
Use cloud technologies such as Azure, OpenShift, VertexAI, etc. to support the ML Engineer by contributing to the development of our core AI platform
Automate infrastructure provisioning (IaC) and CI/CD processes for custom AI workloads



Follow Machine Learning processes and Best Practices


Develop and maintain best practices and standards for carrying out AI based projects
Collaboration with the team in identifying areas for improvement and recommend strategies to enhance the data science function in our organization
Ensure continuous learning and development
Stay up to date with the latest developments in AI to ensure that our practices are cutting-edge



What You Bring


A master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field
5+ years of experience in AI and Data Science and it would be great if you have experience within manufacturing
2+ years of experience of working with LLMs, transformer models, vector databases, RAG frameworks, Langchain, etc.
Excellent skills within Python, SQL, and cloud computing technologies
Experience with Python packages such as FastAPI, SQLAlchemy and Pydantic
Hands on experience in deploying models and algorithms into production systems is desirable
Experience with ML Ops tools and frameworks such as Kubeflow, MLflow, e.g. is desirable
Experience with Kubernetes and Docker is desirable
Professional proficiency in the English language



As a person you are curious and solution oriented. You can easily communicate complex content across functions and to non-technical colleagues. Furthermore, you have a structured way of working forward and take pride in delivering high quality output.

ROCKWOOL are keen to nurture employees in developing their talents and move forward in their careers. You can expect to be supported in your professional ambitions through our programs, to help you reach your professional goals.

Ready to apply?

If you want to know more, please contact Manager of AI CoE Shabab Akhter, shabab.akhter@rockwool.com. Please submit your CV and motivational letter before September 15, 2025.

Who We Are

We are the world leader in stone wool solutions. Founded in 1937 in Denmark, we transform volcanic rock into safe, sustainable products that help people and communities thrive. We are a global company with more than 12,000 employees, located in 40+ countries with 51 manufacturing facilities, all focused on one common purpose – to release the natural power of stone to enrich modern living.

Sustainability is central to our business strategy. ROCKWOOL was one of the first companies to commit to actively contributing to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG’s) framework and are actively committed to 11 SDGs, including SDG 14, Life Below Water. Through our partnership with the One Ocean Foundation and in connection with our sponsorship of the Denmark SailGP team, we will help raise awareness around ocean health challenges in an effort to accelerate solutions to protect it.

Diverse and Inclusive Culture

We want all our people to feel valued, respected, included and heard. We employ 79 different nationalities worldwide and are committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees, promote diversity, and work against all forms of discrimination among ROCKWOOL employees.
Show more

You will be part of a growing team that focuses on developing custom AI products & LLM solutions. The role requires a blend of technical and communication skills. More concretely, you will have the following responsibilities :

Develop and deploy AI products & applications

  • Use various modern technologies, tools and packages such as Azure OpenAI, LLMs, vector databases, Langchain etc. to engineer AI products at scale
  • Maintain custom GenAI products such as in house developed LLM solutions
  • Develop and maintain various LLM APIs and backend functionality that supports custom AI products
  • Use cloud technologies such as Azure, OpenShift, VertexAI, etc. to support the ML Engineer by contributing to the development of our core AI platform
  • Automate infrastructure provisioning (IaC) and CI/CD processes for custom AI workloads


Follow Machine Learning processes and Best Practices

  • Develop and maintain best practices and standards for carrying out AI based projects
  • Collaboration with the team in identifying areas for improvement and recommend strategies to enhance the data science function in our organization
  • Ensure continuous learning and development
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in AI to ensure that our practices are cutting-edge


What You Bring

  • A master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field
  • 5+ years of experience in AI and Data Science and it would be great if you have experience within manufacturing
  • 2+ years of experience of working with LLMs, transformer models, vector databases, RAG frameworks, Langchain, etc.
  • Excellent skills within Python, SQL, and cloud computing technologies
  • Experience with Python packages such as FastAPI, SQLAlchemy and Pydantic
  • Hands on experience in deploying models and algorithms into production systems is desirable
  • Experience with ML Ops tools and frameworks such as Kubeflow, MLflow, e.g. is desirable
  • Experience with Kubernetes and Docker is desirable
  • Professional proficiency in the English language


As a person you are curious and solution oriented. You can easily communicate complex content across functions and to non-technical colleagues. Furthermore, you have a structured way of working forward and take pride in delivering high quality output.

ROCKWOOL are keen to nurture employees in developing their talents and move forward in their careers. You can expect to be supported in your professional ambitions through our programs, to help you reach your professional goals.

Ready to apply?

If you want to know more, please contact Manager of AI CoE Shabab Akhter, shabab.akhter@rockwool.com. Please submit your CV and motivational letter before September 15, 2025.

Who We Are

We are the world leader in stone wool solutions. Founded in 1937 in Denmark, we transform volcanic rock into safe, sustainable products that help people and communities thrive. We are a global company with more than 12,000 employees, located in 40+ countries with 51 manufacturing facilities, all focused on one common purpose – to release the natural power of stone to enrich modern living.

Sustainability is central to our business strategy. ROCKWOOL was one of the first companies to commit to actively contributing to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG’s) framework and are actively committed to 11 SDGs, including SDG 14, Life Below Water. Through our partnership with the One Ocean Foundation and in connection with our sponsorship of the Denmark SailGP team, we will help raise awareness around ocean health challenges in an effort to accelerate solutions to protect it.

Diverse and Inclusive Culture

We want all our people to feel valued, respected, included and heard. We employ 79 different nationalities worldwide and are committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees, promote diversity, and work against all forms of discrimination among ROCKWOOL employees.

Title: Senior Software Developer, robotics
Description:
Job Description

Ready to shape the future of airport automation? Join us in creating solutions that power the next generation of baggage handling systems worldwide. As a Senior Software Developer, you’ll design innovative solutions that drive efficiency and reliability in airport baggage handling systems.

The airport market is booming, and the demand for advanced baggage handling systems is higher than ever. BEUMER Group's systems sort over 100.000 bags daily in some of our largest hubs ensuring efficient airport operations and safe travel for passengers.

Our customers seek innovative solutions to make their airports more efficient, including the full automation of manual processes through technologies such as mobile carrier robots, articulated robots, computer vision software, and in general, with a strong focus on digitalization as a key driver of efficiency.

To meet these needs, we are intensifying our focus on innovation, aiming to bring new products to market faster to address our customers’ evolving needs. As part of this new strategy, we continuously explore ways to enhance our baggage handling systems – making this an exciting time to join BEUMER Group.

Developing the products of tomorrow

As our new Senior Software Developer, you will join a global, cross-functional Innovation & Development team consisting of highly skilled people within vison, mechanical, electrical engineering, data analytics and software. The team's mission is to innovate products and systems within the airport business domain.

With our highly skilled team you will be a part of all processes – from analysis and development to test and implementation – it is up to you to:


Lead embedded software development of new products and architecture of the products
Give input to automation strategy and technical requirements
Set product requirements in collaboration with the business
Evaluate and select appropriate technologies for automation and orchestration
Use best practices and standards for automation, testing, and quality assurance


The position is in Aarhus, and you will have stakeholders within the organization – both locally and internationally.

Senior Software Developer with a proven track record within robotics

The role calls for a candidate with a strong background in designing and implementing embedded/robotics solutions across various software platforms. You are innovative, proactive, and able to develop automation systems that enhance efficiency and drive business value. Moreover, you bring the following qualifications to the job:


Experience in software automation architecture and systems design
Strong expertise in a wide range of software tools (e.g., GitLab, Docker), programming languages (e.g. C++, Python), operating systems (e.g., Linux), simulation environments (e.g., Gazebo, UNITY), and frameworks (e.g., ROS2)
Solid understanding of DevOps principles and CI/CD pipelines
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a dynamic environment.


Want to know more? See our video from Qatar Airport: Baggage Handling - BEUMER Group.

Interested?

If you have any questions regarding this position, please do not hesitate to contact Senior Project Manager Søren Østergaard on +45 5378 5783 or Talent Acquisition Specialist Eva Holm Mikkelsen on +45 3161 9466. We interview for the position from mid-August.

BEUMER Group

Conveying, loading, palletising, packing, sortation and distribution – BEUMER Group is a leader within the development and manufacture of high-technological intralogistics systems for global markets. Our employees stand out from others thanks to their ability to supply innovative solutions to our customers. They can do this because they know the industry and are passionate about continuously developing and expanding their knowledge. We support these high standards through teamwork, mutual respect and a work culture based on trust that fosters stability and security for all of our employees. Our common goal is to implement outstanding and innovative projects worldwide.
Show more

Title: Process Development Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

REDUCED is at the forefront of B2B upcycling, pioneering fermentation technologies that transform food industry side streams into high-quality savoury ingredients. Our mission is to elevate the power of gastronomic sciences to food industry quality standards while creating value in the circular food industry.

As a growing food-tech startup, we’re seeking a Process Development Engineer to help us develop our solid product portfolio, optimise flavour retention and scale innovative powder-based ingredients with world-class quality and stability.

Position Overview

In this role, you’ll lead the technical analysis and development efforts to produce a clean-label, solid product portfolio. From understanding which technologies best fit our products to optimising formulations you’ll be responsible for executing the Industrial product development with CMOs.

This is a hands-on, cross-functional role involving technology assessment, lab-scale development, pilot-scale trials, and coordination with co-manufacturers to scale products consistently.

Key Responsibilities

Technology Development


Evaluate and select the suitable technologies to build a robust solid product portfolio, with a strong focus on flavour optimisation and process scalability.
Manage technical interactions/transfers and understand manufacturability in production and at CMO(s).
Conduct root cause analysis and troubleshooting of production challenges (caking, inconsistent particle size, flavour degradation).


Process Control and Quality


Ensure manufacturability, economy and safety of solid product line according to the FSSC22000 standard
Document and monitor KPIs for yield improvement, flavour retention (≥ 90%), and product shelf life (≥ 5 years).
Create and maintain SOPs covering feed preparation, drying/concentrating parameters, and downstream product handling.


Process Optimisation and Scale-Up


Ensure pilot scale facilities to provide solid developmental progress
Optimise feed/product preparation (natural carriers, emulsions, encapsulation matrices) to maximise flavour stability while meeting clean-label standards.
Scale processes from benchtop to pilot and industrial production, ensuring robust transfer protocols and reproducibility (≥ 95% success rate).


Documentation, Data Management and Design


Assist in the design, development and costing of future plant
Define detailed process descriptions, SOPs, and technical data sheets to support technology transfer and regulatory needs.
Maintain accurate experimental records linking process conditions to flavour delivery and product stability.


Success Criteria


Improve yield by ≥ 40% during scale-up.
Deliver ≥ 90% flavour compound retention across drying and storage.
Ensure ≥ 5-year shelf life stability under standard conditions.
Drive cross-functional alignment to meet R&D, operations, and quality goals across multiple production sites.


Qualifications


Master's degree in chemical, Mechanical, or Food Engineering
5+ years of hands-on experience in process development for solid product and process engineering.
Proven track record of flavour optimisation, encapsulation, and clean-label formulation.
Strong technical knowledge of natural carrier systems (carbohydrates, proteins, lipids) and their role in encapsulation efficiency.
Proficiency in process modelling, drying kinetics, and advanced analytical tools (GC-MS, particle size analysis, water activity, sensory evaluation).
Demonstrated success in scaling food products from lab to commercial to production.
Strong project management, troubleshooting, and cross-functional collaboration skills.


Benefits


Make a direct impact by shaping REDUCED’s solid product portfolio and technology platform.
Competitive salary with performance incentives.
Flexible working environment in Copenhagen’s Frederiksberg/Nordhavn neighbourhoods.
Opportunity to join a mission-driven startup on its way to deliver impact at scale through food-tech innovation.


Application Process

Send your CV and cover letter (in 1 pdf document) highlighting your experience with process development/ optimisation and scale-up of clean-label products. Please include examples of previous work that improved yield, flavour retention, or product shelf life.
Show more

Title: Freelance Earth Science Expert - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Earth Science, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI.
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers.
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree or PhD in Earth Science or in relevant area is required
You have a 3 years of professional experience ideally as analyst or in a relevant fields
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above.
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Scientist
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Protein Purification Scientist, in Enzyme Research, R&D

Join us as our new Research Scientist in our Prototype department, R&D

You will be responsible for production and purification of protein/enzyme samples for several different projects and various applications, as well as alignment with stakeholders about the quality needs and progression on tasks. Besides this you will also be involved in optimizing processes and developing methods.

Welcome to the ´Prototyping´ department.

We are a dedicated department consisting of three teams, of which you will be part of the protein purification team. The team currently comprises 3 scientists and 6 laboratory technicians. You will be joining an agile team where we assist and help each other in solving purification tasks including fermentation in shake flask, purification on Äkta’s and characterizing the resulting enzyme prototypes. By delivering prototypes, in the form of purified protein samples, the team enables fast progress of projects across different industries in Novonesis R&D.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By


Ensure timely coordination with stakeholders regarding quality needs and progression
Actively being a part of the laboratory and ensuring the purification of the desired enzyme
Participating in troubleshooting and optimization of purification methods
Clearly communicating data, conclusions and progress to key stakeholders


To Succeed You Must


Hold a Masters degree or PhD within biotechnology or similar areas
Have solid experience with protein purification using Äkta’s
Have solid experience with different principles of purification, HIC, IEX, MMC, SEC, and AC
Preferably have experience with enzyme assays and characterization
Preferably have a desire for working in a laboratory setting
Have curiosity towards laboratory automatization and digitalization
Be a team player motivated by common goals and collaboration
Be responsible and outgoing while enjoying the communication with stakeholders


Location: This job will be in Denmark at our Innovation Campus in Kgs. Lyngby.

Application deadline: 21 September, 2025

Contact details: If you need further information or have questions to the above, please contact Scientist Casper Normann Nurup (cann@novonesis.com) or Director Hanne Philbert Nielsen (hpns@novonesis.com)

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is dedicated to fostering a unique community by embracing and respecting differences. We make all employment decisions based on business needs, ensuring that every individual can thrive, regardless of identity or background such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Stay alert: Avoid recruitment scams

At Novonesis, We Are Committed To Maintaining a Safe And Transparent Recruitment Process. Please Be Aware Of Potential Scams Targeting Job Seekers And Take Note Of The Following


Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.


If you receive suspicious communication claiming to be from Novonesis, please do not share any personal or financial information. We encourage you to verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us directly through our official channels.

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Want to join us as we take AI to the next level? Then you might be our AI Engineer.

We are a market leader in the utilization of AI, including LLMs, and have even greater visions. In the Digital Incubation and AI team, we work both as an internal AI consultant and development team, and as a strategic team, shaping our approach and architecture around generative AI. And this is where you come in.

As our AI Engineer, you will collaborate with both your colleagues on the team, and stakeholders across the company to scope, develop, and deploy leading AI solutions, as well as help design and build the underlying AI infrastructure, including working directly with AI models.

The team you will be part of - Digital Incubation and AI

As part of our Digital, Data and IT (DDI) function of +200 employees, we support the GN Group across the world, delivering business critical applications and infrastructure.

As part of our inclusive and engaging team of AI developers, digital product designers, adoption specialists, and others, you will receive a warm welcome from all members.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:

Your role will involve guiding the evolution of AI technologies through the selection, tweaking, and deployment of models, as well as crafting the core architecture and platforms, and developing solutions for end users.

Specifically, your work will include, but is not limited to, the following assignments


Scoping, planning, and development of AI solutions on various platforms.
Documenting existing processes as well as the developed solutions.
AI model development, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training and evaluation.
Participating and leading projects to scope, develop, and deploy value-driving solutions.
Further iterating solutions once they reach production in a DevOps setup.


You will be challenged with the complexity of a truly global organization and in this context, you will need to navigate across cultures, functions, and organizational levels.

To thrive in the role, we imagine that you:

We imagine that you are team-oriented and can manage your own tasks when necessary. You are result-oriented with an open mind-set for collaborating. You demonstrate accountability and are prepared to operate within a fluid work environment, having experience with Agile practices or being open to acquiring that knowledge.

Moreover, we imagine that you have:


A higher educational background within Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science or a related field of study.
Proficiency in relevant programming languages, such as Python (prioritized), Java, or C++.
Experience working with data and data libraries, such as NumPy and pandas.
Experience in designing and experimenting with algorithms and models for various use cases.
Familiarity with Azure app Service - and applicants with familiarity with Azure DevOps and experience with both open-source models and frameworks are encouraged to apply.
Fluency in written and spoken English, since it is essential you can communicate effortlessly with your colleagues, no matter where in the World they are. If you are fluent in one of the Scandinavian languages it is a benefit, but this not a perquisite for the position.


Your new position will benefit from your openness to learning and your inquisitive nature.

We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy, that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure success for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 7th of September 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying – quick and easy.

If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Thomas Grønfeldt Senger, head of Digital Incubation and AI, on LinkedIn or on +45 27799947.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiast.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.
Show more
HTML:
Want to join us as we take AI to the next level? Then you might be our AI Engineer.

We are a market leader in the utilization of AI, including LLMs, and have even greater visions. In the Digital Incubation and AI team, we work both as an internal AI consultant and development team, and as a strategic team, shaping our approach and architecture around generative AI. And this is where you come in.

As our AI Engineer, you will collaborate with both your colleagues on the team, and stakeholders across the company to scope, develop, and deploy leading AI solutions, as well as help design and build the underlying AI infrastructure, including working directly with AI models.

The team you will be part of - Digital Incubation and AI

As part of our Digital, Data and IT (DDI) function of +200 employees, we support the GN Group across the world, delivering business critical applications and infrastructure.

As part of our inclusive and engaging team of AI developers, digital product designers, adoption specialists, and others, you will receive a warm welcome from all members.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:

Your role will involve guiding the evolution of AI technologies through the selection, tweaking, and deployment of models, as well as crafting the core architecture and platforms, and developing solutions for end users.

Specifically, your work will include, but is not limited to, the following assignments

  • Scoping, planning, and development of AI solutions on various platforms.
  • Documenting existing processes as well as the developed solutions.
  • AI model development, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training and evaluation.
  • Participating and leading projects to scope, develop, and deploy value-driving solutions.
  • Further iterating solutions once they reach production in a DevOps setup.

You will be challenged with the complexity of a truly global organization and in this context, you will need to navigate across cultures, functions, and organizational levels.

To thrive in the role, we imagine that you:

We imagine that you are team-oriented and can manage your own tasks when necessary. You are result-oriented with an open mind-set for collaborating. You demonstrate accountability and are prepared to operate within a fluid work environment, having experience with Agile practices or being open to acquiring that knowledge.

Moreover, we imagine that you have:

  • A higher educational background within Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science or a related field of study.
  • Proficiency in relevant programming languages, such as Python (prioritized), Java, or C++.
  • Experience working with data and data libraries, such as NumPy and pandas.
  • Experience in designing and experimenting with algorithms and models for various use cases.
  • Familiarity with Azure app Service - and applicants with familiarity with Azure DevOps and experience with both open-source models and frameworks are encouraged to apply.
  • Fluency in written and spoken English, since it is essential you can communicate effortlessly with your colleagues, no matter where in the World they are. If you are fluent in one of the Scandinavian languages it is a benefit, but this not a perquisite for the position.

Your new position will benefit from your openness to learning and your inquisitive nature.

We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy, that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure success for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 7th of September 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying – quick and easy.

If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Thomas Grønfeldt Senger, head of Digital Incubation and AI, on LinkedIn or on +45 27799947.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models to meet project-specific guidelines.
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
Ensuring clarity, consistency, and factual accuracy.
Providing feedback to writers and working with QA Specialists to uphold quality


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
Experience with Cloud sourcing platform is a plus
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Freelance Business Analyst - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

We are looking for a sharp, structured, and intellectually curious business analyst who can dive into a specific industry or problem area and extract a clear, structured understanding of its processes, roles, and task landscape. Your mission: help us reverse-engineer how work is done in a particular domain - who does what, what decisions are made, what edge cases exist, and how workflows are structured. Your output will be used to build high-quality evaluation tasks and agent simulations.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Analyze how a procurement department handles vendor onboarding, and list all key steps, documents, decisions, and failure points
Research the typical day of a customer support agent in fintech and structure it into reproducible tasks
Create a list of evaluation scenarios based on how HR departments handle leave requests, performance reviews, and conflict resolution
Interview an industry SME (or use online materials) to produce a structured map of compliance workflows in healthcare


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree or PhD in Business Administration, Information Systems or Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering or in relevant area is required
You have a 3 years of professional experience ideally as analyst or in a relevant fields
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above.
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: Client Advisor
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About The Job

As a Client Advisor, you will be an ambassador of the Brand, ensuring that every Client is treated accordingly to the Louis Vuitton promise. You will strive to discover your Clients and their every need, and to guide them across the Brand.

You will proactively reach out to your Clients in order to achieve individual and team goals.

Job responsibilities


Drive and achieve individual and team objectives and be accountable for sales results,
Welcome every Client and provide the best Client experience,
Engage with Clients to develop long-term relationships, leveraging different clienteling tools, in order to foster brand loyalty,
Perform as a team-player, participate in all activities contributing to the overall objectives of the store,
Learn and master Brand and product knowledge,
Respect Louis Vuitton Brand standards in terms of grooming and behavior,
Follow the company’s policies and procedures.


Profile


Passion for the Brand and client experiences,
Proactive and commercial mindset & excellent interpersonal skills,
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment,
Detail-oriented and organized,
Professional attitude,
Team player,
Strong command of English and Danish.


Recruitment steps


Following the submission of your application, you will receive via email the first feedback on your application.
Successful applicants will be moving to the first steps of the recruitment process, to complete an EasyRecrue video interview. Please keep an eye on your emails as the invitation will be sent from ICIMS.
Following the video interview, there will be (minimum) two rounds of interviews either via Zoom or in person (with Store Management team and HR).


Reference LVM28916
Show more

Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:

Participate in Friends Show the Way , where we match refugees with local volunteers

Create community in our cozy integration cafes in the Network House by the train station.

Title: Process Development Engineer - Spray Drying
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our client is a pioneering food technology company specializing in creating unique, high-impact flavor solutions from upcycled raw materials. Thus, they both help to create organic and great tasting flavor concentrates but also eliminates a lot of food waste. The more they can scale, the more they can also reduce this waste (as well as needless CO2 emissions), and there is certainly shortage of supply in this market, just the technology to actually take advantage of it.




Today they have roughly 35 employees today and are expanding with a Process Development Engineer with particular skills within spray drying (or similar technology). This position is part of their R&D team but it stands out as you will be the most experienced with drying technology.




You will spearhead the advancement of their solid product portfolio and you role is central for them to develop and scale innovative, powder-based ingredients while ensuring quality, stability, and flavour retention.




You will be leading end-to-end processes, from technology assessment and lab-scale formulation to pilot trials and industrial-scale production, including working with CDMO’s and the related tech transfers. This is both hands-on and quite a cross-functional position requiring so you get both a bit of the science and a lot of the engineering aspects.




Location/Salary:

We are open to discuss the salary and benefit package more in detail as well as potential relocation to Denmark if needed. Our client is located in Copehagen, where this position will be based (They have R&D and smaller production capabilities there). For now we are mainly looking at candidates with a visa or a right to work in Denmark (EU/Schengen citizens).




Key Responsibilities

Technology & Process Development for Commercialization:Lead the development and commercialization of new solid product lines by converting complex liquid flavorings into powders.
Screen, assess, and select the most suitable drying technologies (spray drying, drum drying, etc.) for the company's unique and challenging product matrix (high fat, sugar, and salt content).
Design and conduct process development trials at laboratory and pilot scales to optimize for flavor retention, sensory quality, yield, and shelflife.




Technology Transfer & External Partner Management:Identify, evaluate, and establish relationships with Contract Manufacturing Organizations (CMOs/CDMOs) for industrialscale production.
Develop and manage the complete technology transfer process, ensuring seamless scaleup and consistent quality at the external partner site.




Product Quality, Stability & Innovation:Define and establish product specifications for new solid product lines, including physical, chemical, and sensory attributes.
Conduct shelflife assessments and develop strategies to ensure product stability and quality over time, including the evaluation of carriers and other ingredients.




Qualifications & ExperienceA minimum of 56 years of practical industrial experience in process development, specifically in converting liquid food products into stable solids/powders. (Academic research, PhDs, or postdocs are not considered equivalent to industrial experience for this role).
Proven experience in managing technology transfer projects and working effectively with CMOs/CDMOs.
Possession of a genuine engineering mindset: practical, solutionoriented, and adept at bridging the gap between lab-scale development and industrial-scale manufacturing.




Preferred:Experience within the food, flavor, or ingredients industry is strongly preferred.
A strong interest in or familiarity with fermentation science and technology is a significant advantage.
Familiarity with food safety and quality management systems (e.g., FSSC 22,000, HACCP) and associated documentation for commercial products.




Application Process

To apply for this unique opportunity or to discuss the role confidentially, please apply below or contact the designated recruitment partner:

Anders Sandberg

Black Swans Exist Recruitment

Show more

Title: Founder's Associate
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Founder’s Associate at Kiku

If you’re a student who wants real exposure to AI, a fast-paced startup environment, and the chance to learn directly from founders — this role is for you.

At Kiku, we’re building the first automation platform for frontline hiring — the 80% of the global workforce that keeps society running. From hospitality to healthcare, logistics to retail — these are the people who make the world work. We’ve just raised a substantial seed round led by Cherry Ventures, PSV, Yellow, and top European angels. Now we’re scaling.

As Founder’s Associate, you’ll work on projects that cut across every part of the business. You’ll:


Research competitors, markets, and compliance topics.
Capture and structure insights from customer, investor, and strategy calls.
Take on critical projects across operations, product, and growth.


What makes this role unique is the access. You’ll sit in on the toughest decisions, the big investor conversations, the customer sessions that shape our product, and the everyday challenges of building a company from the ground up. You’ll see the reality of how startups are built — not in theory, but in practice.

It’s 20 hours per week, based in our Copenhagen office, working directly with me (Eric, CEO) and Rasmus (CTO).

If you want to learn how companies are built — the real way — and you’re ready to contribute from day one, reach out.
Show more

Title: Vice President- Head of LEGO Fortnite ecosystem
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role must be based in Denmark full time

Are you passionate about contributing to the future of family friendly digital play?

Your ability to think on your feet whilst paving the way for a long term ambition will be critical to lead this strategic project for the LEGO Group. Acting like a GM and owning the P&L, you will own our strategic partnership with EPIC Games, ensuring constant mutual value creation and reaching both short and long term goals.

The LEGO Fortnite partnership is multifaceted, from stand alone licensed games, to self developed and published games, to user generated games, and you will lead and establish a meaningful presence inside the ever growing and changing Fortnite environment.


Core Responsibilities





Strategic Partnership management with EPIC Games
P&L ownership
Portfolio development across 1st, 2nd and 3rd party games
Publishing, marketing and UA experience
Driving short and long-term integration with the LEGO owned ecosystem
Continuous development of in-house capabilities




Play your part in our team succeeding

The LEGO Group has decided to dramatically expand its footprint in the gaming world. The EPIC Games partnership sits at the core of this strategy, establishing a long-term presence in open platforms.

You will drive the choices to accelerate the growth of our Fortnite audience, making the most out of what Fortnite has to offer, developing valuable business cases for EPIC Games to invest in and building in-house capabilities to create meaningful LEGO gaming experiences within Fortnite.

Making difficult decisions and negotiating with our partners, you be strong in navigating uncertainty, whilst remaining driven by a unique goal- delighting as many players as possible with LEGO Experiences!

Do you have what it takes?





Deep experience in digital platform management and/or gaming industry
Successful experiences in maintaining and developing strategic partnerships
P&L and digital product development experience
Understanding of legal and financial considerations, incl internal collaborator management
Deep gaming industry knowledge
Understanding / interest for kid-focused experiences
Program management
Marketing and branding strategy
Creator community management




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. For all candidates, if you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more

Job Description

This role must be based in Denmark full time

Are you passionate about contributing to the future of family friendly digital play?

Your ability to think on your feet whilst paving the way for a long term ambition will be critical to lead this strategic project for the LEGO Group. Acting like a GM and owning the P&L, you will own our strategic partnership with EPIC Games, ensuring constant mutual value creation and reaching both short and long term goals.

The LEGO Fortnite partnership is multifaceted, from stand alone licensed games, to self developed and published games, to user generated games, and you will lead and establish a meaningful presence inside the ever growing and changing Fortnite environment.


Core Responsibilities



  • Strategic Partnership management with EPIC Games
  • P&L ownership
  • Portfolio development across 1st, 2nd and 3rd party games
  • Publishing, marketing and UA experience
  • Driving short and long-term integration with the LEGO owned ecosystem
  • Continuous development of in-house capabilities



Play your part in our team succeeding

The LEGO Group has decided to dramatically expand its footprint in the gaming world. The EPIC Games partnership sits at the core of this strategy, establishing a long-term presence in open platforms.

You will drive the choices to accelerate the growth of our Fortnite audience, making the most out of what Fortnite has to offer, developing valuable business cases for EPIC Games to invest in and building in-house capabilities to create meaningful LEGO gaming experiences within Fortnite.

Making difficult decisions and negotiating with our partners, you be strong in navigating uncertainty, whilst remaining driven by a unique goal- delighting as many players as possible with LEGO Experiences!

Do you have what it takes?



  • Deep experience in digital platform management and/or gaming industry
  • Successful experiences in maintaining and developing strategic partnerships
  • P&L and digital product development experience
  • Understanding of legal and financial considerations, incl internal collaborator management
  • Deep gaming industry knowledge
  • Understanding / interest for kid-focused experiences
  • Program management
  • Marketing and branding strategy
  • Creator community management



Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Title: AI Engineer - The Flex Europe
Description:
About The Flex

The Flex is on a mission to transform the global rental sector. We believe that renting a home should be as seamless as buying from Amazon. Our platform empowers tenants to rent anywhere in the world effortlessly, while providing landlords with hassle-free property management—without excessive fees. We are assembling a world-class team of ambitious, growth-minded individuals ready to scale The Flex into a global leader. We reward initiative and promote from within.

Position Summary

As an AI Engineer, you will be at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence into The Flex’s systems. You’ll build, deploy, and optimize AI-driven tools and models that support operations, customer experience, automation, and decision-making. This is a high-impact role with the potential to shape the future of tech in the real estate industry.

Key Responsibilities


AI & ML Development: Build and train machine learning models for use cases like pricing optimization, Property Management Tools.
LLM Integration: Develop and integrate LLM-powered features (e.g., GPT APIs) into internal tools and customer-facing products.
Automation: Leverage AI to automate repetitive internal tasks, enhance support, and improve user experience.
Deployment: Package and deploy models into production using modern MLOps tools and cloud infrastructure (preferably AWS).
Collaboration: Work closely with engineers, product managers, and operations teams to identify and implement impactful AI opportunities.
Documentation & Maintenance: Ensure reproducibility, versioning, and continuous improvement of all AI models and pipelines.


What We’re Looking For


Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset.
Clear communication and a collaborative attitude.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, remote-first startup environment.


Why Join The Flex?


Join an innovative company revolutionizing the real estate and hospitality space.
Play a key role in building AI products from the ground up.
Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
Growth-oriented culture with fast career progression.
Work remotely with a flexible schedule and a dynamic team.


You Should Not Apply If


You are looking for a traditional corporate 9 to 5 job.
You engage in office politics or gossip.
You want a slow-paced role with no growth.
You do not strive to be world-class at what you do.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about solving business challenges through data? Do you have robust experience with data analytics, data engineering and data visualization methodologies and tools? Are you good at collaborating and communicating with various stakeholders, collecting and understanding their needs? Are you a structured person with the right mix of analytical skills and business acumen? If so, join us!

What the job is …

We are a team of Data Analysts and Process Managers who form the Business Performance and Improvement unit within Product Management. The role of our unit is to drive all projects, initiatives, analytics and automation required to lead the transformation of Product Management towards a data and process centric organization. Our end goal? Drive growth, boost business performance and competitiveness.

The position is located in Copenhagen, Denmark.

In your position as Data Analyst you will be required to:


Support the development of an online platform by leading the work package responsible for data collection, data analysis and data quality
Work and collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges and opportunities that can be addressed through data analytics and automation.
Lead the development of digital tools, automation and dashboards to support decision making, corporate presentations, etc.
Process and transform complex, high-volume data from multiple sources.
Acquire datasets and ensure data quality and availability.
Communicate complex analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Support the data-driven transformation of Product Management.


What do you offer?

You are an enthusiastic team player, self-driven, proactive, structured and autonomous with a business-oriented mindset. You are curious and enjoy providing solutions to business needs. You demonstrate excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex analytical and technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Ideally, You Have


3-5 years of professional experience in Data Analytics
MSc in Mathematics, Computer science, or a related field.
Good experience of programming languages such as Python and R.
Proven experience in developing and implementing analytics solutions in a business context.
Fluency in English.


What does your next challenge look like?

At SATAIR, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe.

We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international and diverse teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow, making an impact on aviation’s digital and sustainable transformation.

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company!

About SATAIR

Satair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers’ orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment.

With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of over $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family.

Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options


Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

Satair (a 100% subsidiary of Airbus) is offering first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. With our global functional organisation spanning across eleven different sites and locations worldwide, you will be part of a truly global family. Change is the only constant at Satair. The aviation industry is an ever changing - and fast moving environment.

That calls for someone special - someone like you!

Welcome to the Satair family!

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company

Satair A/S

Contract Type

Permanent

Experience Level

Professional

Job Family

Digital

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Head of Product & AI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Simply.TV

Simply.TV is a high-growth, PE-backed metadata and content discovery platform serving broadcasters, telcos, and streaming platforms globally. Backed by Summit Partners, we recently expanded into the U.S. with the acquisition of FYI (formerly Red Bee Media's metadata division) — marking the first step in our ambitious M&A and global growth strategy.

We operate at the intersection of metadata and content intelligence, powering modern entertainment discovery experiences. We are now building the next generation of data-driven products: blending editorial-grade quality with AI-powered automation, analytics, and personalized discovery.

The role

We're seeking a Head of Product & AI to lead our full product organization and AI product strategy. This is a highly strategic role responsible for setting and executing the company-wide product roadmap — with direct accountability for both customer-facing product innovation and AI-driven internal tooling.

As Simply.TV transitions from a pure metadata provider to a broader data and analytics platform, this leader will be pivotal in scaling product development, embedding AI across the value chain, and driving commercial and operational impact.

You will report directly to the CEO, work closely with our board, and serve as the strategic link between Engineering, GTM, Operations, and Data.

Key Responsibilities

Product Strategy & Roadmap


Define and own the end-to-end product vision, strategy, and roadmap across our product offerings
Build and maintain a rigorous prioritization process grounded in customer impact, commercial value, and technical feasibility
Collaborate with Commercial, Operations, and Engineering to align roadmap with business objectives and market feedback
Present roadmap updates and tradeoffs directly to the CEO, Leadership Team, and Board


AI and applied ML leadership


Drive Simply.TV's AI product strategy, shaping how AI is embedded across both external products and internal operations
Design and lead initiatives that apply AI and LLMs to elevate our data platform and editorial workflows
Identify high-impact use cases where AI can enhance customer value or drive operational efficiency
Expand and evolve our AI-powered product features, ensuring they align with customer needs and market trends
Evaluate, test, and integrate cutting-edge AI models, frameworks and toolkits


Product execution and team leadership


Build and lead a high-performing Product & AI team — hiring PMs, ML product leads, and analysts as needed
Establish product development best practices (OKRs, product specs, feedback loops)
Drive clear handoffs with Engineering, ensure on-time delivery, and uphold quality standards
Foster a culture of experimentation, iteration, and customer obsession


Requirements


8+ years of experience in Product Management, with 3+ years in AI/ML product leadership
Deep expertise in applied AI/ML, with a track record of building and scaling AI-native products
Experience working with LLMs and generative AI, ideally in areas like content processing, natural language understanding, or search
Background in or deep familiarity with data-centric companies, with a strong grasp of data pipelines, governance, and quality
Proven ability to set product vision, translate into actionable roadmaps, and drive org-wide alignment
Experience applying AI/ML to complex, high-volume data environments (e.g. media, SaaS, search, marketplaces, etc.)
Sharp product instincts and bias for execution in dynamic, high-growth settings
Executive presence with ability to present to board-level stakeholders and communicate tradeoffs clearly
Strong understanding of the metadata and media landscape is a plus (EPGs, schedules, enrichment, etc.)
Familiarity with modern AI/ML tooling: OpenAI, HuggingFace, LangChain, Pinecone/Weaviate, etc
Ability to engage deeply with engineers and data scientists to scope AI solutions
Solid grasp of LLM architectures, retrieval-augmented generation, fine-tuning, and evaluation metrics
Show more

Title: Vice President- Head of LEGO Fortnite ecosystem
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role must be based in Denmark full time

Are you passionate about contributing to the future of family friendly digital play?

Your ability to think on your feet whilst paving the way for a long term ambition will be critical to lead this strategic project for the LEGO Group. Acting like a GM and owning the P&L, you will own our strategic partnership with EPIC Games, ensuring constant mutual value creation and reaching both short and long term goals.

The LEGO Fortnite partnership is multifaceted, from stand alone licensed games, to self developed and published games, to user generated games, and you will lead and establish a meaningful presence inside the ever growing and changing Fortnite environment.

Continuous development of in-house capabilities




Play your part in our team succeeding
